You will have to build your castle, grow crops, and keep your livestock alive so that you can defend yourself from other players or for the brave venture out and lay siege with catapults and take others riches for your own.

Source: The Publisher Website.

171597.name: The Awakened Fate Ultimatum
171597.description:
User Summary

The Awakened Fate Ultimatum takes place several years after the events of The Guided Fate Paradox and will feature a new main character, a boy from the human world. After being injured by devils, the boy is saved by a girl and is taken to the world of Celestia. He then gets caught up in a war between angels and demons.

171599.name: Smooth Operators
171599.description:
User Summary

Smooth Operators is simulation game where you take control of a call center company, and hopefully lead it to financial success!

Features:
- A highly addictive game with numerous hours of gameplay.
- Customize your company by placing offices and furnitures where you want to
- Upgrade everything! you can improve things like employees, offices, elevators etc

171600.name: GamersGoMakers
171600.description:
In GamersGoMakers, you found a little company creating the first video games in history. Create your first game with only basic sound and simple graphics available in the year 1980. You´re one of the pioneers entering the rising global market for computer games. At the beginning, there are only few genres you can pick for a game to create, later you have plenty of options for more genres and sub-genres.

Features


You start in 1980 creating one of the first computer games in history
Go your own way: Be a developer, designer, producer, artist or composer
Optional start in 1990 or 2000, choose from 3 difficulty levels
31 genres of games to choose from
Real influence on creating games (find the genre matching game parts out of 15×4 options)
Intelligent game reviews give you hints about what to improve for next game in same genre
Sales are influenced by trends, platform market share, competitor´s performance and many more
You can create patches, addons, sequels or a new edition for a different platform
Hire up to 25 employees with specialisations in genre and/or platform
Rich role playing elements: level up your character and employees in 25 different skills
Learning by doing: Your employees gain levels in skills by takig part in projects
Improve your employees skills additionally by trainings, education programs and specializations
Employees will ask for more loan, holiday, trainings or they get sick, maybe even quit for a better job at a rival´s company
Become a specialized company of high renown in a certain genre, e.g. the global number 1 in Shooter games
Research new gaming technologies
Expand your business, rent or buy a bigger office
Equip 15 different rooms like studios for sound and motioncapture, labs and marketing office
Create a Game Engine
Upgrade your rooms several times as time advances
Compete within a global simulated games market – hundreds of simulated competitors release games
Win awards for game of the month/game of the year
Participate in conventions or create your own conventio
Become a publisher by yourself
Hire “real” actors for voice acting, motion capturing and soundtrack
Consoles and platforms retire from the market…except you create a game hit extending the platform´s lifetime
Buy out your rival competitors: Let them work for you or destroy them


Source: The Game Website.

171601.name: Rulers of Nations: Geopolitical Simulator 2
171601.description:
Rulers of Nations is a geopolitical simulator of the current world. Players play heads of state or governments (presidents, kings, prime ministers . . . ) of the countries that they choose at the beginning of the game. They can take initiatives in several areas—economic, social, military, domestic and foreign policy, environment, culture, etc.

All the countries of the world are represented, with their variables and their own modes of functioning.
The game includes phases for economic management, trade, wargame, construction, espionage, simulation, and political manipulation.

Two game modes are available :


Global competition, mode that can be played solo or with multiple players, which sets 16 great nations against each other (played by artificial intelligence or other human players). In this mode, no holds are barred in the race to become the greatest nation in the world. The players can choose their secret objectives that will increase their score once they are reached. Online player rankings, as well as a list of matches currently playing are available on this site.



World simulation, where the player leads one of the 170 proposed nations. There are about 20 contextual scenarios in tune with current events such as "Get out of the world crisis", "Afghanistan: The new Vietnam?", and "Terrorist threats at the 2012 Olympic Games in London!".


Source: The Game Website.

171602.description:
A promo card from Spielbox #07/2014 featuring the city of Carcassonne on the one side and Sherlock Holmes' residence 221B Baker Street in London on the other side.

This is a bonus question card just like the regular ones.
171602.name: Terra: 221B Baker Street / Carcassonne Promo Card

171603.name: Farming World
171603.description:
Whether you specialise in grain, fruits or even maintaining your own dairy farm, in Farming World you have the ultimate choice on how you shape your business. With dozens of seed types to choose from and an extensive stock market listing, you’ll have to adapt to become profitable. With plenty of seeds growing at different seasons, you’ll need to stock up so you can sell when produce is most in demand.

As you continue to increase your profits though, that small patch of land you started with is not going to cut it. In this PC farming simulator game, you’ll need to expand your farm’s reaches across the map. Land can be purchased if you’re wealthy enough but for those with a limited budget you might be better off renting the it until you can afford to own your entire farm. As you obtain more fields to work in, you’ll have to construct roads which allow your vehicles to navigate to the correct patch of land so they can harvest and maintain the fields.

In order to maintain your farm you’ll need to construct a selection of buildings from a selection of over 40 to including; greenhouses, bakeries and butcheries . You’ll also be able to purchase animals from the traditional chickens and cows to the more unconventional domestic turkeys and ostriches.

Features of Excalibur’s Farming World:


Develop road networks for your vehicles to use
Purchase and rent land
Over 30 different types of seeds to plant
Over 40 building types
12 Different animals to purchase
Take on contracts to earn more money
Detailed weather reports


Source: The Publisher Website.

171604.name: Taxi
171604.description:
A mixture of driving simulator and an arcade game, Taxi! pits you with the responsibility of running your very own taxi cab business. Starting out with an under powered and dated vehicle you’ll strive towards upgrading your current vehicles specs by improving its speed and handling. Once you’ve managed to secure a good source of revenue it’s time to expand your business by purchasing new vehicles and hiring drivers. Be cautious of who you select to offer a job as each taxi driver will excel in a particular area but may under perform in others. If you’re concerned about paying to repair your car do not choose a driver that is reckless for the sake of earning extra cash.

Taxi! includes three cities for you to set up your company. You can take to the U.S where the city will feature traditional American apartments or you can travel to the United Kingdom with consistent roundabouts. There’s also a beautiful European style city that will need to be explored. All of these cities are rendered with stylised cartoon graphics with each of the maps recreating the driving conditions for its country. Whether you want left hand or right hand drive, Taxi! lets you choose where and how you want to drive.

Not only will you be behind the wheel to complete fares, you’ll also need to work on the management of your company at all levels. This will include assigning drivers to vehicles, repairing your cabs, upgrading engine parts and locating secret packages on the map to unlock new vehicles.

The missions are incredibly varied, ranging from simple dispatch missions, following other drivers and perilously balancing luggage atop your car while taking corners carefully to make sure none of your passengers valuables fall victim to the bustling traffic.

Features of Taxi!


3 cities based on the United Kingdom, the U.S. and Europe
Cartoon-style visuals
Manage a taxi cab company and expand your taxi fleet
Repair, clean and upgrade your taxi cabs
Several missions ranging from traditional dispatch to balancing luggage atop your cab
Unlock vehicles by collecting car parts scattered across the cities


Source: The Publisher Website.

171605.description:
The beautiful Filly Butterflies are excited, because Princess Scarlet is visiting. She ha brought sparkling crystals, which they generously hands out in the magic Papillia garden.

To reach all Fillies, the princess travels from place to place. With a little luck of the dice and courage to some take risks you can get hold of a lot of colorful glitter stones. Here we go!

In Filly Butterfly: Sammle deine Funkelsteine (Filly Butterfly: Collect your Glitter Stones), each player attempts to collect as many crystals as possible.

At the beginning of the game, all players receive the same amount of crystals.

The board shows six locations in Papillia; each location has some spaces for crystals. A Princess Scarlet pawn is placed on one of the location.

Players take turns rolling the die and moving Princess Scarlet a number of spaces clockwise, as indicated on the die. If Princess Scarlet ends her move in a location that still has an empty spot for a crystal, the active player has to place one of his crystals there, and may then roll the die again, if desired. On the other hand, if Princess Scarlet ends her move on a location that has no more empty spots, the active player may take all crystals from that location, and his turn ends.

The game ends when one player has no more crystals left. Then, the player who has collected the most crystals wins.
171605.name: Filly Butterfly: Sammle deine Funkelsteine

171607.name: Santiago de Cuba
171607.description:
“Santiago de Cuba” is an economical game, descendant of the world popular board game “Cuba”. The player should establish relations with local people to realize more profit. Players of “Santiago de Cuba” do not have lands as in “Cuba” board game but they have start-up budget such as money, resources, and victory points. Now players are not landlords, they are quick-witted businessmen, so they drive around the city trying to make money out of any possible ways.

Be ready to develop your acumen here, under the hot sun, amid the noise of the crowd, busy commerce and cargo vessels whistles. You need to unleash your economic potential and strategic vision to provide with goods vessels that regularly come to one of the biggest cities in Cuba.
The main goal of the game is to win all opponents and become the best businessman in Cuba.

Here you will find:
• Good graphic design and sound accompaniment.
• Possibility of local network game.
• Pass-and-Play regime for four players on one iPad.
• Single matches against artificial intellect.
• Detailed on-line tutorial.
• Possibility to play with friends in Game center.
• Chat for all gaming regimes.
• Hall of Fame for network play.
• Different difficulty levels for artificial intellect.

Source: Bytex LLC

171609.name: Ping Time
171609.description:
From the authors webpage:
An adventure I wrote as a one-shot for Gen Con 2006, and as such might need a bit of adapting for your campaign. Its difficulty level is set for starting characters. Mr. Johnson has lost her friend, a technomancer. She can connect to him via the Matrix, but neither of them know where he is physically.

171610.name: Biglands: A Game Made By Kids
171610.description:
User Summary

The game is a gift to the developer's (Diego Acevedo) nephews. The story, name and gameplay is created by them, and a lot of the items, weapons, bosses etc are taken from the drawings done by the said nephews.

171611.name: Born to Die
171611.description:
From the authors webpage:
An adventure I wrote as a one-shot for Gen Con 2006, and as such might need a bit of adapting for your campaign. Its difficulty level is set for starting characters. Mr. Johnson's pregnant girlfriend has been kidnapped. Somehow toxic spirits are involved. Call you crazy, but you're pretty sure that's on the Surgeon General's list of things pregnant women should avoid. The team is called in to reinforce another team, only to arrive too late. They pick up the first team's job, and wind up in the middle of a pretty dark and twisted run.

171612.name: Lost Chronicles of Zerzura
171612.description:
Join a young inventor on the expedition of his life. A remarkable journey from Spain, across the Mediterranean, to distant Africa; a quest to save his own soul and lives of those he holds most dear. Two brothers operate a workshop that is well ahead of its time in Barcelona of 1514. It’s the time of the golden epoch of the Renaissance, a time of discoveries and inventions; but also the brutal age of the Inquisition. One brother puts all his efforts into building a flying machine, while the other dreams of Egypt and mysterious art treasures. The advanced ideas and exotic fantasies weaved by the pair arouses the suspicions of the Grand Inquisitor. Quite suddenly their small world is turned upside down as one brother is taken away by the Inquisition; leaving the other alone to search for answers that will set his imprisoned sibling free. Explore the ravishingly beautiful and detailed locations of this remarkable adventure as you become immersed in this mysterious medieval tale and solve a unique combination of puzzles, mini-games, and other challenges that are perfectly integrated within this breathtaking storyline. Evade further attacks by the inquisition, and forge strong alliances with those you meet along the way. Trek across different countries and cultures and eventually to the legendary desert city of ZERZURA, where an ancient terror guards over powerful secrets - and poses the greatest challenge of all!

Source: The Publisher Website.

171613.name: The Last Run
171613.description:
From the authors webpage:
An adventure I wrote as a one-shot for Gen Con 2006, and as such might need a bit of adapting for your campaign. Its difficulty level is set for starting characters. This is a heist adventure designed to be very much a one-shot, as the payoff for the run is enough for several runners to retire in wealth. Unless you're using this one as your last run, you'll want to tone down the payoff.

171614.name: Minotaur
171614.description:
From publisher blurb:

This race of bovine humanoids looks as if it were plucked from the pages of a classical Greek text or from any of the countless pieces of popular fiction that the ancient works inspired. With the head, legs, and tail of a bull or cow, and a humanoid body, they are the legendary creature incarnate. Minotaur are fixtures of the Civilized Lands and beyond, known for their physical strength and endurance, and for their strength of family and community.

The first in a series of mini-expansions for the Breachworld RPG, the Minotaur is a unique and new character race, fully integrated into the fabric of the world.

Included in this supplement:

Minotaur character creation stats
Detailed background and origins
Discussion of disposition and culture
Detailed description, with new illustrations
An overview of Mad Minotaur Disease
One new Perk for general use within the RPG
Five quick-stat Minotaur characters

171615.name: Carnival
171615.description:
From the adventures introduction:

Prologue
On the Tacoma air so often laced with heavy metals, the acid tang of refineries, assembly lines and the vapours of the sluggish Puget Sound another scent had overlain itself. Cotton candy, crepes and toffees mingled with the industrial air, making it sweet and cancerous all at once. A wide lot, vacant yesterday and long ago bulldozed empty of anything but tarmac and the memory of jobs, was now filled with tents, trucks and temptations for children of all ages. The Carnival had come to Seattle, nestling itself in the city's empty spaces as it had once settled itself in farmers' fields, unheeding Time. A few beefy trolls manhandled the poles of the last tent with ease and a dwarf with grease paint forcing a permanent smile on his face jammed fliers under the wipers of the cars crawling past in the slow rush hour traffic.

“Come to the carnival,” they said. “An experience you'll never forget.”

171616.name: Square Heroes
171616.description:
Description

Square Heroes is a hilarious comic arena shooter featuring Online, LAN, Co-op and local multi-player; a single-player Tournament; and an arsenal of weapons to blast your friends out of the sky!

History

After completing the prequel, Square Off, the Gnomic team noticed that the most common feedback was along the lines of "Hey this game is great! With online multiplayer it could be AWESOME". After stewing on this, they realised that despite the technical challenges, this was feedback worth following up on. Development started in earnest at the beginning of 2013 when the team expanded to take on the multi-player vision. During 2014, the team sought and was granted funding by Screen Australia through the now defunct Games Production fund. Square Heroes will be released on PC, Mac and Linux in October 2014 with console platforms to follow.

Features


Online and local multi-player, at the same time. AKA couch vs couch gaming.
Cross platform multi-player.
Unique arms-race gameplay mechanic where chosen weapons are earned during each round by collecting loot.
Unlockable weapons and hats with stat-buffing perks.
Various game modes including Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Gnome Hunt, Team Gnome Hunt and Survival.
Numerous challenging Achievements.
Seven stylish 2.5D arenas of doom.
Originally scored music and professionally crafted sound effects.


Source: The Developer Website.

171617.name: Garden Gnome Carnage
171617.description:
User Summary

In Garden Gnome Carnage you control the Christmas hating gnome who is doing his best to stop an army of Santas, elves and presents from spreading cheer. Your gnome achieves this by putting a brick apartment building on wheels, attaching a rope to the chimney and whirling yourself around like a...like a gnome attached to a chimney.

171618.name: Cold Blood (Shadowrun)
171618.description:
From the adventures introduction:

Introduction

This is a basic Shadowrun mission suitable for starting players to learn some of the rules or as a short emergency game for a more experienced group. The challenge level is scaled relatively low and is gauged towards the example characters in Shadowrun 4th edition. Scaling the power level should be relatively easy.

The plot consists of the players being hired to break into a corporate facility and retrieve a blood sample of an employee's wife before it is sent for testing at a medical laboratory and the fact that she is infected with the Kreiger strain HMHVV (the “ghoul” virus) is discovered. As cover, the characters are expected to damage certain items of equipment to conceal the true purpose of the break in.

171619.name: Castle: Never Judge A Book By Its Cover
171619.description:
Step into the shoes of Richard Castle and Kate Beckett as they track down a dangerous killer. You'll explore locations and interact with characters taken directly from the TV show in this game from ABC Studios and GameMill Entertainment.

Source: The Developer Website.

171620.name: Thieves!
171620.description:
In the speedy bluffing card game Thieves!, players are crafty crooks making a break for it after a huge heist! You must carefully amass the greatest stash of loot while keeping an eye on the growing police presence -- if a raid is triggered, the player with the most loot at that moment is busted and loses all the loot they are holding! Then the game continues, with more loot and raids on the horizon! Can you escape in the end with the biggest share of loot?

Each round you draw a card and play one from your hand. Will you play a loot card face down in front of yourself, so no one knows what you're holding? Or will you play it face up in front of another player to overload their stash? Police cards and special Thief cards are there to affect the game as well. If a player draws a getaway car, it has to immediately be played on the table, and when a seventh getaway car shows up, the player with the most valuable loot wins the game!

Thieves! is a simple, interactive card game that will captivate both beginners and advanced players!

171621.description: The Spurs Pioneer Promo ads a new character to the Spurs Universe known as the Pioneer. He is a balanced character whose special ability is he reduces terrain movement costs.
171621.name: Spurs: A Tale in the Old West – Pioneer Promo

149097.name: Spurs: A Tale in the Old West

171622.name: La Primavera de Rudesindus
171622.description:
DE LA WEB DE LA EDITORIAL

La Primavera de Rudesindus es un divertido suplemento lleno de nuevos personajes, lugares y tareas para jugar a La Torre de Rudesindus. Este libreto inaugura una colección en la que visitaremos la torre del mago más famoso del mundo en todas las estaciones.

La Torre de Rudesindus en un juego de interpretación para dos o más jugadores que te convierte en un diminuto demonio servidor de un gran mago, entregados a realizar los aparentemente sencillos encargos del amo de la torre en su ausencia.

Necesitarás La Torre de Rudesindus para utilizar correctamente este suplemento, tres dados de seis caras y una campanilla para jugar a este divertido juego.


Translated by Google

(From Publisher Blurb)

La Primavera de Rudesindus is a fun supplement full of new characters, locations and tasks to play La Torre de Rudesindus. This script opens a collection that tower visit world's most famous magician in all seasons.

La Torre de Rudesindus interpretation in a game for two or more players makes you a tiny server daemon a great magician, dedicated to doing the seemingly simple orders of the master of the tower in his absence.

La Torre de Rudesindus need to properly use this supplement, three six-sided dice and a bell to play this fun game.

186554.name: The Voyages of Marco Polo: The New Characters

boardgamehonor.28189: 2015 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Family/Adult Game Winner

171623.description:
In 1271, 17-year-old Marco Polo started on a journey to China with his father and older brother. After a long and grueling journey that led through Jerusalem and Mesopotamia and over the "Silk Road", they reached the court of Kublai Khan in 1275.

In The Voyages of Marco Polo, players recreate this journey, with each player having a different character and special power in the game. The game is played over five rounds. Each round, the players roll their five personal dice and can perform one action each turn with them. The five main actions are shown on the bottom part of the board:


Get resources with 1-3 dice, depending on the value of the resource (camels, pepper, silk, gold). The first player for each resource gets them for free; the later ones have to pay according to the value shown on the dice.



Take one resource of your choice and two camels. Each player sets the minimum value for the future dice.



Earn money, with any one die netting you five money.



Purchase orders: The value of one die unlocks the orders up to that number (shown on the spaces) and allows you to buy one or two of those orders. Orders are refreshed and placed at the beginning of each round. To fulfill an order, players have to spend resources for victory points, other resources, camels, and more.



Travel: Two dice are placed to unlock the distance that can be traveled on the upper part of the board, that is, the map. Here, the traveler piece of each player starts at Venice and can decide between several routes eastward, all the way to Beijing. When a traveler stops at a city, they place a marker there, giving them access to a different additional action for the rest of the game.


After five rounds, the game ends with players receiving victory points for arriving in Beijing, fulfilling the most orders, and having reached the cities on secret city cards that each player gets at the start of the game; these points are added to the VPs gained during the game.

Auf den Spuren von Marco Polo should not be confused with Marco Polo Expedition, which had the same German title.
171623.name: The Voyages of Marco Polo

171624.name: Timber Rafting Channel
171624.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 234th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a short piece of a timber rafting channel at the bottom of a valley.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4320x4032 pixels in size at 144dpi.

171625.description:
Full Throttle! is an expansion kit for either of the two "Legend" games covering the Mille Miglia road races across Italy – Legend: The History of 1000 Miglia and Legend: The 1000 Miglia Action Game. Full Throttle! adds more player interaction, competition and fun to either game.

Full Throttle! includes two decks of cards: the 72 full-sized card Main deck (used in game play) and the 40 mini card Locales deck (used as reminder markers).

There are 12 different card types in the Main deck, consisting of 7 obstacles which can negatively affect a player, and 5 situations that can negatively or positively affect the chance of the obstacle's effect. The obstacles are: Pothole, Landslide, Spectators, Animal, Intersection, Fog, and Railroad Crossing Gate Down. The situations are Fatigue, Hangover, Sober Up, Fog Lifts, and Railroad Crossing Gate Up.

The Main deck cards are organized into 6 suits: Mountains, Forest, Farmlands, Towns, Bad Roads, and Night. The Locales deck consists of 6 card types corresponding to the suits in the Main deck.
171625.name: Full Throttle!

171626.description:
The wheel of fortune determines where you hares may hop to in this exciting race! You'll have to watch out for holes and the pushing mole. With a bit of luck, your hare will be the first to reach the carrot.

Lotti Karotti: Das Hasenrennen is a racing game. Each player is a hare, racing towards the carrot. Each turn, a player spins the spinner, which determines how far ahead he must move. If his move ends in a hole, he is returned to the starting field. When a player reaches the carrot, he wins the game.

The spinner has some other outcomes as well, allowing the player to cover a hole (uncovering another one), moving a bridge (which allows for shortcuts) or pushing another player backwards using the mole.
171626.name: Lotti Karotti: Das Hasenrennen

171627.description:
For 2-6 players, players work together to prevent the fabric of all reality from being torn asunder, all while competing against one another to further their own personal goals.

The ultimate Creator of all universes is also a mindless force of chaos and destruction. That which it has created it will eventually destroy. It is mindless, but all-powerful. The first of its creations to survive and assume intelligence consider themselves Its sons and daughters: the Excubiae. At the beginning of time, they worked together to seal away the Great Nameless, in order to protect the Realms they had created for their own progeny.

In true Shakespearean fashion, these siblings developed alliances and rivalries, and began working with and against one another, all while their Creator attempted to work Its way through their ancient seals...

In Arkhangel: The Great Nameless, each player assumes the identity of their very own god. They lord over their own Realm, create miracles, and force their worshippers to do their bidding. They may even manifest in physical form, greatly affecting the battlefield before them.

The game consists of different decks, tailored to each god, and a central, autonomous deck that represents the unstoppable force that is The Great Nameless.

Players race up and down a doom track to seal away their Realms from the center of the board, and work to help their allies and sabotage their enemies.

Players accumulate victory points for placing seals, destroying the armies of The Great Nameless, destroying the forces of their foes, and playing valuable cards of their own.
171627.name: Arkhangel: The Great Nameless

171628.description:
Bad Lands: Curse of the Skinwalker is a western horror co-op survival game where you and your friends take control of a posse of heroes fighting off a pack of vicious were-beasts and other folklore creatures.

Build your own adventures - The Bad Lands box comes with 6 heavy duty, double-sided, linen coated Board Tiles. You only need 4 Board Tiles play. We will include several different pre-made adventures for you and your friends to play, or you can make your own! The board tiles are double sided, and you can lay them out in a variety of ways to build your town your way.

Form your Posse - Bad Lands is a co-op survival game for 1-4 players. While most players will just control 1 Hero per game, you can still quite easily have a larger posse. The more Heroes in the adventure, the more Villains you will have to face, and the tougher the game will be.

Kill Some Bad Guys - Bad Lands features a whole host of vicious Skinwalkers and minion beasts for your Heroes to vanquish. The core boxed game comes with a deck of 30 Encounter Cards. You draw a card, and it tells you what Villains are going to jump out and attack the Heroes.

Get some Loot! - Of course, no adventure is complete without cool rewards. When you defeat tough Villains, they will leave a Loot Marker behind. If your Hero picks one up, you can draw a Loot Card from the deck. Each Hero may carry an unimited amount of Loot Cards, but may only equip and use two.
171628.name: Bad Lands: Curse of the Skinwalker

171629.name: The Golden Cobra Anthology 2014
171629.description:
User summary

This document collects all of the entries for the 2014 Golden Cobra challenge for freeform games. (Dimension & layouts vary between games, covers are standard Letter)

From the introduction
The goal of the 2014 contest was to generate games playable at large conventions like Gen Con, where time and space are in short supply.

In order to be considered for a Golden Cobra, games had to:
1. Be playable from start to finish in two hours or less.
2. Be playable by a variable but small number of participants, ideally a wide range like 2-8.
3. Be playable in a public space, like an open lounge in a busy hallway.
4. Optionally, use the ingredients Chord, Light, Solution, Bear and Minute.

Golden Cobras were awarded in four categories:
Most Convention-Ready (Group Date, page 290)
Most Appealing to Newcomers (Unheroes, page 551)
Cleverest Design (Glitch Iteration, page 248)
Game We’re Most Eager to Play (Still Life, page 507).

171630.description:
Game description from the publisher:

You have been caught looting the hoard of the dreaded Drakon. For such transgression, a fiery death should be the only appropriate response — but Drakon has decided to toy with you before she devours you. You and your rival heroes will each be released into the labyrinth, and the first hero to discover ten gold pieces will go free with his treasure. The rest of you will satisfy the dragon's hunger.

In every game of Drakon, you and your opponents must fight to stay alive in the midst of the labyrinth. On your turn, you can either move your hero to another room, or add another piece to the labyrinth, placing beneficial chambers in your own path and throwing your opponents into harm's way. But you must be cautious. The chambers of Drakon's labyrinth are filled with danger and ancient magics, not to mention the dragon herself. To navigate these deadly corridors and survive, you’ll need to be quick and careful.

On every turn, you have a crucial choice to make. You can either move forward into a new chamber, or you can expand the labyrinth by playing a new chamber tile from your hand. The new chambers that you play feature unique circumstances and magical objects that you may encounter on your adventures through Drakon's lair.

The majority of these chambers offer powerful effects to any hero that enters the chamber. You may gain the power to destroy any chamber in the labyrinth, or call a windstorm to carry you along, increasing your movement. You may even take command of a floating chamber and fly it to the other side of the labyrinth. Other chambers force more harmful effects on those heroes unlucky enough to enter. A room may cause you to lose a coin as you avoid the dangers within, and any hero who hears the siren song of the magical harp is forced to move into its chamber. As you and your fellow heroes play these chambers from your hand, they form a cunning maze, and only the wise can find their way out.

Despite the power of these chambers, the central goal of your quest is to find gold: only by being the first player to claim ten gold can you escape the dungeon. Plenty of chambers allow you to find a coin or steal a coin from an opponent, but the gold value of coins can vary dramatically. Your most recently stolen coin may have a value of three gold or just one. Because coins are kept face-down, hiding their value, you'll never know exactly how close your opponents are to victory.

Six heroes are trapped within Drakon's sadistic labyrinth, and each hero has his own unique abilities to help him survive. Each ability can only be used once per game though, making the timing of the ability incredibly important. You may play as the sorceress and escape from a most dire situation by passing through a wall. You may play as the thief and collect the gold you need at the most opportune moment by preying on another hero. You may even play as the ranger and use a burst of speed to race across the maze when necessary. No matter which hero you play in a game of Drakon, you'll need to take full advantage of your unique ability at the opportune moment if you want to grab the gold and escape from Drakon's clutches.

Of course, the heroes are not alone in the labyrinth. The legendary dragon also stalks the halls and chambers of the maze, taunting any hero unlucky enough to encounter her. Certain chambers throughout the labyrinth allow you to move Drakon through the dungeon. If you can move Drakon into the same chamber as a hapless hero, that hero is immediately sent back to the entrance chamber and loses three coins, as Drakon toys with him before releasing him once more into the maze.

You and your rival heroes are trapped. Your greatest threat may be Drakon or the other heroes. In this dark labyrinth, only one thing can save you: your own greed. Will you ruthlessly grab gold and undermine your opponent’s schemes before escaping to victory? Or will you fail and become just another meal for the dragon? You decide your fate, but only one hero can escape from Drakon!
171630.name: Drakon (fourth edition)

171631.description:
This expansion includes new variants of play and a sticker sheet with 24 stickers, 6 stickers for each color, which are attached to the back of the playing pieces.

Variant 1 - Adds a General that may order adjacent pieces to move/rotate as a free action per turn.
Variant 2 - Adds a Hero with the strength & weight of 2 men.
Variant 3 - Adds the Fury that will rout the enemy that routed the Fury.
Variant 4 - Adds a Knight that has a free action of move/rotation per turn.

From the author:

The rules and components needed for various expansions and variants for Nika.

Nika is the ancient Greek word for “Conquer!” The concept of Nika came to me in a dream while I was studying abroad in Athens. The rules were honed across nearly two years of testing. The board shape and core mechanics were inspired by ancient Greek geography and warfare. Greece has many narrow valleys and mountain passes, and sometimes the only way to defeat an enemy force was to collide with them head-on and literally push them off the field. This othismos (“shoving”) is thought to have been the critical phase of most battles between hoplite armies, who were the heavy infantry that dominated ancient Greek war for four centuries. In this game, you command a Greek city’s hoplite soldiers who must force their way through enemy lines. Your troops can push or rout those who would block their way across the narrow battlefield. Coordinate attacks with your ally to secure victory, but make sure to watch your flanks!
171631.name: Nika: Rules and Variants

171632.description:
From the designer:
"Very cool, wooden turn marker piece in the shape of a hoplite helmet.
“Nika is the ancient Greek word for “Conquer!” The concept of Nika came to me in a dream while I was studying abroad in Athens. The rules were honed across nearly two years of testing. The board shape and core mechanics were inspired by ancient Greek geography and warfare. Greece has many narrow valleys and mountain passes, and sometimes the only way to defeat an enemy force was to collide with them head-on and literally push them off the field. This othismos (“shoving”) is thought to have been the critical phase of most battles between hoplite armies, who were the heavy infantry that dominated ancient Greek war for four centuries. In this game, you command a Greek city’s hoplite soldiers who must force their way through enemy lines. Your troops can push or rout those who would block their way across the narrow battlefield. Coordinate attacks with your ally to secure victory, but make sure to watch your flanks!”

-- Josh Raab, designer of Nika"
171632.name: Nika: Corinthian Helmet Turn Marker

171633.description:
From the designer:
"4-page, illustrated strategy guide called "The Art of Nika". This is a collection of strategic maxims and diagrams, split into sections on Basic Advice, Attacking, Defending, Formation Tactics, Openings, and Endgame.
Nika is the ancient Greek word for “Conquer!” The concept of Nika came to me in a dream while I was studying abroad in Athens. The rules were honed across nearly two years of testing. The board shape and core mechanics were inspired by ancient Greek geography and warfare. Greece has many narrow valleys and mountain passes, and sometimes the only way to defeat an enemy force was to collide with them head-on and literally push them off the field. This othismos (“shoving”) is thought to have been the critical phase of most battles between hoplite armies, who were the heavy infantry that dominated ancient Greek war for four centuries. In this game, you command a Greek city’s hoplite soldiers who must force their way through enemy lines. Your troops can push or rout those who would block their way across the narrow battlefield. Coordinate attacks with your ally to secure victory, but make sure to watch your flanks!”

-- Josh Raab, designer of Nika"
171633.name: Nika: Strategy Guide

171634.description:
Camp Grizzly is a semi-cooperative survival horror board game.

The Behind the Bear Expansion includes:
- Introduces a new deck of OTIS cards with hidden traitor rules.
- 18 NEW CABIN/SURVIVAL/OTIS CARDS INCLUDE; Arts and Crafts, Bloodlust, Daddy Dearest, It was me all along, Final Scare, Stop and Explain, Disarm, Teddy bear's picnic (and more!).
- NEW COUNSELOR JUMBO CARD AND PAWN: Saffron - The 'Flower Child'
171634.name: Camp Grizzly: Expansion #3 – Behind the Bear

171635.description:
A selection of some of our worst ideas.
18 NEW CABIN/SURVIVAL CARDS INCLUDE; Banana Board, Dream Warrior, Derp!, Tres Hermanos Brothers, Duster Jacket, Sexy Lady Bear Disguise, Hell Puzzle, Doobie the Dog Sleuth, Animal Control, Pointed Stick, Black Lotus (and more!).
4 NEW JUMBO FINALES INCLUDE: Bthulhu, "Now let's see who you really are", The Time Tower, Otis 2000.
NEW COUNSELOR JUMBO CARD AND PAWN: Chet - The 'Rich Kid'
171635.name: Camp Grizzly: Expansion #4 – Jump the Bear

171636.description:
If there isn't enough gore in Camp Grizzly for you, we've saved the most violent images for our final expansion.
18 NEW SNUFFED DECK/CABIN/SURVIVAL CARDS INCLUDING: Bee Hive, Bear Skin Rug, Stuffed, The Red Room, Chipper Shredder, High Tension, Lawnmower, John The Carpenter, Eye for an Eye (and more!).
4 NEW JUMBO FINALES
NEW COUNSELOR JUMBO CARD AND PAWN: Jason - The 'Horror Fan'
171636.name: Camp Grizzly: Expansion #5 – Rated R

171637.name: Fritz und Franz: Die beiden Ausreißer
171637.description:
Up to two players play the two runaways Fritz and Franz. The other players play the brother, sister, wench or servant, who try to catch the runaways. The runaways get a headstart and start at space 6. Every time a pursuer gets on the same space as a runaway, he gets 2 gamecoins. At space 7 the drawing of a card decides, which way to follow. Only Fritz and Franz may choose their way. On several spaces, the players get benefits or obstructions. If Fritz or Franz are the first to arrive at space 60, both runaways have won the game. If a pursuer is the first to arrive, he wins the game.

The game was published in the 1920s. It seems to be inspired by "Max und Moritz"

171639.name: Brothers in Arms: Art of War
171639.description:
Brothers in Arms: Art of War is a game developed and published by Gameloft for mobile phones, based on Gearbox's Brothers in Arms series.

Art of War is chiefly a top-down shooter, featuring 13 missions in 3 campaigns, including Operation Market Garden. The game also includes parachute missions, rail shooter plane, tank and boat missions, as well as a destructible environment.

Source: Wikipedia, "Brothers in Arms: Art of War", available under the CC-BY-SA License.


You are Jason Becker, commander of the 101st Airborne Division. In 12 seconds you'll be parachuting from an airplane with your men towards your first objective. Prepare to land in the midst of terror...

Get ready for intense battles, reliving 1944's Operation Market Garden, as well as other high-risk infantry missions in North Africa and in a V2 factory in Germany.

For the first time on mobile, parachute directly into anti-aircraft fire, bring down enemy planes, and prepare for the worst in the face of enemies determined to do whatever it takes to prevent you from completing your mission.

The new, explosive episode of the celebrated "Brothers In Arms" series.
- 13 intense missions from 3 campaigns including the famous Operation Market Garden.
- Never-before-seen situations: Parachute missions, first-person cannon fire on planes, boats, etc.
- Drive a tank and use a variety of arms: Machine Gun, Bazooka, Mortar, Explosives...
- New, dynamic shooting gameplay and breathtaking explosions.
- Numerous scenery elements to destroy (buildings, bridges, trees, etc.)

Source: The Developer Website.

171640.name: Vengeance
171640.description:
From publisher blurb:

The discovery that your grandfather has been murdered by outlaws shatters the solitude of your peaceful existence. Taking up your sword and bow you set out upon a dangerous path of revenge while you seek to satiate your thirst for vengeance. Your quest will lead you deep into the depths of the ancient Moonglade Forest, as you seek to retrieve a mysterious item that was stolen. Will you be able to uncover the truth behind the reason for your grandfather's brutal murder? Welcome adventurer to Greywood Publishing's first Epic Adventure Game Book - Vengeance, set in the mythical lands of The Four Vales. Unlike a normal book, this is an interactive game book that allows you to create a character and decide your own path through the story. Choose your destiny or discover your fate! The choice will be yours.

171641.description: The players start at the Driving School at space A and have to traverse the game board till they arrive at space E back at the Driving School. On several spaces the players get points, penality points, obstructions or benefits. The first player to arrive at space E gets 12 poits, the second 6 points, the third 3 points and the rest get 1 point. The player who gets the most points, wins the game.
171641.name: Die Fahrschule

171642.name: Bresium: The Jungle Amazons
171642.description:
From publisher blurb:

To the west and south of the Confederacy lies the tropical land of Bresium, governed by a gynarchy. The people who tamed Bresium were normal men and women bringing their families to find hope and peace in a new land. Disaster, however, befell the settlers in the form of a wasting disease unique to the jungles of Bresium. After an exposure of several weeks, all the males died off. Not willing to return to their lands of origin, the women remained to establish a new nation, one ruled by women.

171643.name: Ivory Pearl Archipelago: The Reaver Kingdom
171643.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Kingdom of the Ivory Pearl is ruled by robber barons, pirates, more accurately. It is a kingdom of islands currently ruled by a ruthless Queen. There are 19 islands in the kingdom, seven with sizable harbors. An “earl,” six in number, controls each harbored island. “Barons” rule thirteen islands. There are no rules of succession; might makes right.

Queen Captain Hester the Reaper rules the kingdom with an iron fist. Her carrack fitted for war, the “Bonny Blood,” is the largest in the fleet, tied up on Ivory Pearl Island, the largest and most central of the isles.

171644.name: The Horseclans of Edda / The Sultanate of Quirtoy
171644.description:
From publisher blurb:

Edda is a great rolling plain, home to the Horse Clans (the Clanurile Cai) of Edda also called the Cai de Oameni or “Horse People,” with clan names such as Clanul Erelide, Clanul Karaci or Clanul Quinquilleros. It is bisected by the Great Beldany River. The Eddans are an interesting people, considering horse as intelligent members of their families rather than property. They have a language very similar to the whickering and neighing of horses, even the braying of donkeys. It is said they can converse with their equine companions.

Quirtoy is a nation of dark mystery. Not much is known of its doings outside its borders and what is known causes fear and trepidation in most people. The facts and figures given below are for the use of the gamemaster. An outworlder ruhlarına danışan kimse olmasın (necromancer) rules this dark and mysterious land. It is known that numerous undead are about the land along with rumors of were creatures.

171645.name: Mini Motor Racing WRT
171645.description:
Mini Motor Racing WRT is the sequel to the critically acclaimed Mini Motor Racing (voted App Store Best Casual Game of 2012), and while Mini Motor Racing WRT features the same fast paced, top-down arcade fun, it takes the action to a whole new level.

The gameplay is more engaging than ever thanks to a rich RPG-style career mode that lets you build a fleet of unique vehicles and assemble the finest hand-picked racing team in your quest to become the World Racing Tournament champion. And if that's not enough, take the challenge to the real world by forming a Race Club with your friends and go head to head with other racers from around the world.

Mini Motor Racing WRT offers unparalleled racing action and depth. Features include:
MASSIVE CAREER MODE
Journey across the world, through dozens of vibrant environments, as you battle your way to the top of the World racing Tour.
CUSTOMIZABLE VEHICLES
Spend race winnings to buy or build dozens of vehicles, then upgrade them to help handle a range of racing conditions, from tarmac to off-road to heavy rain.
RACING TEAMS
Staff your race team with the best mechanics, managers, and engineers, all with unique strengths and weaknesses that have in-game effects on your performance.
RACE CLUBS
Team up with your friends and challenge other clubs to head-to-head battles with fame, glory, and massive prizes on the line.

With incredible HD graphics, over 30 new and classic tracks, league and challenge modes, club battles, massive single player career, officially licensed Nissan, KIA and Choro-Q (penny racer) vehicles, Mini Motor Racing WRT is the ultimate racing experience for mobile.

Source: The Developer Website.

171646.name: Sword of Asumi
171646.description:
Welcome to Edo, an alternate realm where history took a different route. The Samurai of Japan were never outlawed and the emperor lost power preventing Japan from opening its borders to the other nations of the world.

Edo is now a very different place from modern Japan, where tradition still holds sway other the people and it's leaders. As time has passed the Samurai have been given ever increasing levels of power by the Council of Nobles and their leader the Lord Regent.

This has given rise to the creation of a special core Samurai unit known as the Justicars, though members are appointed by the council, they remain an autonomous unit, able to investigate and judge any threat or criminal they find. It is their duty to safeguard the continuity and protect the people. But Edo is not a land of peace and plenty, strife exists in all corners of the once great empire. Rival factions constantly battle for land and power whilst rebellion grows from within.

Enter Asumi - A female samurai of the black clan, trained from birth to kill on command. Now newly appointed as a Justicar of Edo. Our protagonist finds herself in a place she never thought she would be, outside of the shadows, within an academy, trying to root out a rebel before civil war can engulf Edo and its people.

Source: The Developer Website.

171647.name: Mega IV - Les Règles
171647.description:
Translated from the website

"Mega is a French Science-Fiction RPG created in the 80s. Initially published as a special issue of Jeux & Stratégie, it live for 3 revisions ; the last one, Mega III, was published by the magazine Casus Belli in the early 1990s.

Mixing several Sci-Fi genre, as well as fantasy and travel through history or bizarre, Mega "le jeu de rôle des messagers galactiques" sent you into extraordinary adventures."

The rulebook will give you all the rules (system) to play Mega IV, including helpers to convert from the previous edition Mega III.

171648.name: Mega IV - Encyclopédie du Messager Galactique
171648.description:
Translated from website

"Mega is a French Science-Fiction RPG created in the 80s. Initially published as a special issue of Jeux & Stratégie, it live for 3 revisions ; the last one, Mega III, was published by the magazine Casus Belli in the early 1990s.

Mixing several Sci-Fi genre, as well as fantasy and travel through history or bizarre, Mega "le jeu de rôle des messagers galactiques" sent you into extraordinary adventures."

The encyclopedia is a compilation of everything that has been published about the universe of Mega from 1984 up to 2012...

171649.name: Galcon (2008)
171649.description:
Galcon is a real time strategy video game developed by Phil Hassey. It is set in space and involves maneuvering fleets of ships to capture enemy planets.

In July 2008, Galcon was publicly released on InstantAction, a web browser game platform released by GarageGames. This is the first time Galcon was released with campaign sort of gameplay.

A couple months later, Galcon was released for the iPhone, frequently called iGalcon by fans. iGalcon was one of the first true multiplayer experiences for the iPhone but never gained enough publicity to kick off. iGalcon comes with multiple single-player modes featuring varying degrees of bot difficulty, and an advanced online multiplayer system where players can battle in rooms up to four.

In June 2009, Galcon Flash was released. Galcon Flash was a Flash port of Galcon and closely resembled the iPhone port. Although Galcon Flash was given a small introductory price, the amount of registered users was very small; however, there is a limited demo version.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galcon Galcon]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

171650.name: Galcon Labs
171650.description:
Galcon is a series of real time strategy video games developed by Phil Hassey. It is set in space and involves maneuvering fleets of ships to capture enemy planets.

Galcon Labs was released in early October 2009. Galcon Labs is a sequel to the first iGalcon. Galcon Labs features four new modes which are both singleplayer and multiplayer compatible. Galcon Labs has been received as a very positive addition to the Galcon series.

A PlayStation minis version was developed and published in October 2011 by Beatshapers.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galcon Galcon]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

171651.name: Galcon (2006)
171651.description:
Galcon is a real time strategy video game developed by Phil Hassey. It is set in space and involves maneuvering fleets of ships to capture enemy planets.

Galcon Classic was released for the desktop in late 2006 for Ludum Dare, a timed game development contest. It was then developed into a more advanced video game. Galcon Classic features dozens of single-player game modes and full multiplayer.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Galcon Galcon]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

User Summary
This installment in the Galcon series was released for Windows, Mac and Linux, and features online multiplayer capability for up to 12 players. It is retrospectively referred to as Galcon Classic to distinguish it from other Galcon games.

171652.name: Galcon Legends
171652.description:
User Summary

Galcon Legends is a one player, campaign/mission-based version of the Galcon series of games. You play as 'Buck', a bill collector. Gameplay is similar to the other Galcon games, whereby you commit ships to interplanetary attacks in an attempt to destroy the enemy.

171653.name: Galcon 2: Galactic Conquest
171653.description:
Galcon 2 is a demolition derby in space! Send swarms of ships from planet to planet to conquer the galaxy in this fast paced multiplayer strategy game! Galcon 2 includes:
- Clans battling for galactic supremacy
- Tournament to prove your amazing skills
- Betting to take Galcoins from the weak
- Multiple ship shapes like triangle and trapezoid
- Slick planets made of lava and ice
Free to Play. Galcon 2 contains In App Purchases for cosmetics, simulated betting, and tournaments.

Source: The Developer Website.

171654.name: Silent Hills
171654.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Silent Hills is an upcoming survival horror video game for PlayStation 4, and the ninth installment of the Silent Hill franchise. It is being directed by Hideo Kojima, with assistance by film director Guillermo del Toro. Actor Norman Reedus will provide motion capture for the yet unnamed protagonist, as well as provide his voice.

Source: Wikipedia, "Silent Hills", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

171655.name: Superman Card Game
171655.description:
Simple "Pairs" card game featuring Superman characters from the 1966 era of the comics.

Rules (From the Rules Card):
Shuffle the cards and deal one at a time until all the cards have been distributed. (Players will not all have the same number of cards.) Each player arranges his hand and lays down any pairs he has been dealt.

Player to the dealer's left begins by drawing a card from the dealer's hand. If he can make a pair, he lays them down. Play then moves clockwise, the player on the left taking a card from the player on his right. The game continues until all the cards have been paired. If a player has used all his cards he waits until his opponents have played all of theirs. The first player to use all his cards receives a bonus of five points, but his pairs can still be captured.

Using the points on each card the scores are then added up and recorded. The first player to reach a score of 50 or the player with the highest score over 50 is the winner.

A Superman card has no value alone. However, it can be used to (a) cancel out a pair of minus cards, (b) capture an opponents pair, (c) protect one of the player's own pairs. It is placed on top of the pair it has captured, cancelled out, or protected from being captured. Players must wait their turn before using a Superman card. After playing the Superman card they also draw from the player on their right. Once a Superman card is used it cannot be used again.

171656.description:
In Terrenus, the players become gods playing a game with the mortal world. The game is player in four phases, each a simple mini-game with different rules, but each building where the other left off. Each phase is roughly ten turns per player. The four phases relate to various godly activities:

Creation - The gods build the game world, using a tile placement mechanism. Each god will place ten, and score points based on number of edges connected and terrain features completed.

Population - Each god has 40 tribes to competitively place on the board, usually 3-5 at a time. The finger of god touches an origin square, and life spreads from it. Terrain features limit how many tribes can fit in an area. Points are scored based on how terrain is filled. This phase feels a little like Go.

Construction - With the world populated, the gods migrate tribes together. When enough are in a square, they build a temple to whichever god has a majority in their stack, and leave the board. Rival tribes are captured and converted by this process. Points are scored by using tribes to build temples, and by converting rivals' tribes. This feels vaguely like the city building mechanic from Civilization (original).

War! - The world is now full of temples. The gods each have a monster and a hero to summon from their temples on their turn. Monsters seek to defile rival temples, making them more difficult to summon from. Heroes go to fight rival heroes and monsters, or just vandalize a rival temple. Points are scored for slaying, defiling and robbing. This phase can feel like the endgame of Chess.

Each phase has a method of earning bonus points. At the end of the last phase, the gods total their scores to determine a winner.
171656.name: Terrenus: The Game of Gods

171657.name: Mage Quest
171657.description:
Long ago in Seven Cities of Gray, two adepts began quests to create libraries of spell books. They sent their allies out across the lands to gather rare elements and the mana needed to aid their growing hunger for power.

Mage Quest is a microgame for 2 players lasting about 30 to 45 minutes. The game is a prequel to Mage Clash.

The object of the game is to create four Spell Books by collecting and trading Elements while moving across lands and seas with ships and caravans.

During the game, each player has two actions per turn with players alternate turns. Players may take any action in any order during their turn and may take the same action twice.

The Actions are:
A. Build a new Ship
B. Convert a Ship into a Caravan or Convert a Caravan into a Ship
C. Move any or all Caravans or Ships
D. Collect Elements
E. Trade (within a City):
1. Trade Elements for Elements
2. Trade Elements for Mana
3. Trade Mana for Allies
4. Invoke Speed
F. Create a Spell Book

171658.name: Game of Goosey Gander
171658.description: Simple race game. Players race around board to get to the Golden nest.

171659.name: Gwandanaland Player's Handbook
171659.description:
From the back of the book:

GWANDANALAND is the new game full of non-stop action and fun!

In GWANDANALAND the players create their own characters and lead them on an adventure through time, across worlds, and into danger. taking the best features of board games, adventure games, and role-playing games, GWANDANALAND is easy to learn, but tough to put away.

It's the game you can play a thousand times, but never play the same game twice!

171660.name: Game of Fun at the Circus
171660.description: Essentially a Snakes and Ladders type game, but with a circus theme. The game uses a spinner for movement. It has four colored wooden pawns for the players to mark their positions.

171661.description: This mini-expansion introduces a press-your-luck element to the game, as well as super weapons with uniquely powerful abilities. These weapons can be destroyed for Victory Points and Energy.
171661.name: Tiny Epic Galaxies: Satellites & Super Weapons Mini Expansion

boardgamehonor.34509: 2015 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee

171662.description:
It's 43,000 BC in Ice Age Europe, the dawn of modern man. In Neanderthal, you are one of three human species: Archaic, Neanderthal, or Cro-Magnon. Assign your males to hunt Pleistocene megafauna, but try to avoid being eaten by predators. Assign your women for teaching your children vocabulary, leading to cognitive fluidity in the next generation and to a tribalistic culture. Specialize your elders for fire, war, big game, inventions, or animal domestications. Choose between three mating strategies: promiscuous, harems, or pair bonding. Victory depends on which strategy you choose, and may include your hunters, elders, women, vocabulary, trophies, inventions, or domesticated animals.

At this point, the players have developed to the point where the companion game Greenland begins, so you can flow one game into another seamlessly.
171662.name: Neanderthal

171663.name: Attila
171663.description:
Attila the Hun was an infamous barbarian warlord whose army of nomadic horsemen terrorized the people of Europe and Western Asia for nearly twenty years.

Attila, on the other hand, is a light and fast-paced game in which one player controls Attila and two of his warriors while the other player controls three Roman soldiers, one of them being Roman general Flavius Aetius.

To set up, players create a playing area from the four game board tiles (such as a 4x5 rectangle), then place their figures on empty spaces. On a turn, you move one of your tokens in a knight's move (as in chess); you can traverse occupied squares and empty space as long as you land on a free space. Then you place a scorched earth tile on any empty space. Players alternate turns, and whoever first can't move a token loses the game!

171664.name: Do-a-Number
171664.description:
Use your wits and think ahead and the numbers will work for you. A competitive board game that combines dice throwing and mathematics.

The board consists of four sets of the numbers 1 to 18, one for each player, and a small pit in the middle. Each player also receives 20 rings in their colour.

Each player takes turns throwing the three dice provided taking turns they use the die values in a math equation to mark numbers in their set with a ring.

e.g; If you throw a 2,3 and 4 you could mark these three numbers as they are
or
2+3=5 and 4
or
2 and 3x4=12
or
2+3x4=18
or
what ever equation you can come up with!

Numbers can be used in any order but can only be utilised once each in any equation each turn. Difficulty scales with the players as they learn to utilise square-roots and more in their equations. Once a players marks all their numbers (1-18) they win the game.

There is also some player interaction as each player has extra loops in their colour. Loops can also be used to block a number on an opponents board. Just achieve the desired number with the dice results and you can place a ring on that number in an opponents set. In order for the opponent to be able to mark the blocked number in their set they must first remove the invading ring. This is done by achieving that number and and using it to discard the opponents ring instead of place more of their own (you have to get the number a second time to put your own ring on it). Discarded rings can not be used again meaning that if any player should lose more than 2 rings they can never complete their set and as such can no longer win. Rings used to block can also be retrieved by their owner if the owner can achieve the same number again.

171665.description:
Together, the clever detectives chase Mister X around London. Do they guess where he flees next - or does Mister X trick them out again?

As the name implies, Scotland Yard Junior is not only a simplified version of Scotland Yard, it has a quite different ruleset, gameplay and dramaturgy.
171665.name: Scotland Yard Junior

boardgamehonor.34502: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee

171668.description:
The Grizzled is a cooperative game about survival in the trenches during the first World War where players win or lose together.

Each round, the current team leader will choose how many cards every player draws. Then, going around the table, players must either play a card in their hand or back out of the mission. Each card represents either threats to the team (such as mortar shells and weather conditions) or negative personality traits (such as frightened or obsessive). At the end of the round, more cards are added to the draw deck. The game ends only if the players can deplete the draw deck as well as their hands without letting time run out.

If one threat shows up too many times, the team fails the mission. The team must play their threats correctly in order to gain any progress. However, most of the information in a players hand remains secret throughout the game.

Planning, teamwork, and a little luck are the tools you'll need to win this cooperative game for two to five players.
171668.name: The Grizzled

boardgamehonor.34502: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee

171669.description:
The Lewis and Clark Expedition, which was commissioned in 1803 and ended in 1806, was the first party of men that went through the North American continent, then returned. During these three years, the leaders Meriwether Lewis and William Clark, along with Sergeant Gass and Sergeant Ordway, wrote page after page about their trip, describing the new plants and animals species they discovered and drawing the maps of unknown areas.

In Discoveries, you play one of the Expedition members: Lewis, Clark, Gass or Ordway. Your goal is to compile as much knowledge as possible in your journal, and in this way advance science thanks to your discoveries.

The Tribe/Discoveries cards you gain during the game score discovery points at the end. To get these cards, you have to perform exploration actions, and to do this you use dice. On your turn, you either:


Play the dice in your action area or on the game board; by doing this, you prepare or perform the exploration, change your dice, or get new possible actions.
Get dice back from the game board or from your opponents' action areas.
171669.name: Discoveries

171670.name: Coming Out Simulator 2014

videogamehonor.32221: 2015 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee

171670.description:
User Summary

A half-true game about the developer's own experience of coming out to his parents.

You play the story through multiple-choice dialogue options.

171671.name: Pudding Wars
171671.description: Pudding is very popular with people in Taiwan, especially children. Almost all of us have eaten pudding, and it is an unforgettable childhood memory for us — but pudding can be used for more than what you think...even for the fun party game Pudding Wars!

171672.description:
Why First? is a racing game in which players vie to be second in order to win.

The game lasts five races, with each race lasting five turns. At the start of each race, players receive a hand of five cards, with each card bearing a value from -4 to +5. The players' pawns start each race on 0 of the racing track. Each turn, players choose a card from their hands and choose which pawn to move with this card, then reveal them simultaneously and move the selected pawns forward or backward based on the cards they played.

After five turns, the race ends and the player in second place on the racing track wins, scoring a number of points equal to his position on the race track. All other players score nothing. (If the winner is in the negative portion of the racing track, he loses points instead.) After five races, sum all of the points scored; the player with the second highest total who has won at least one race wins.

This revised version of Why First? has new rules, including simultaneous actions by players that cuts down the playing time from the original release.
171672.name: Why First?

171673.name: Roverseiland
171673.description:
Three robbers took a treasure and hid it in their castle. This castle is on the island in the middle of the deep lake in robbers forest. Each player tries to conquer the treasure, the fastest player wins the game.

First, each player has the get hold of the necessary attributes to make the crossing to the castle: a hat as a disguise, a boat as transport and a key to get in. These attributes are available on special fields in the robbers forest. A simple dice game helps the players with that.

When someone has collected the necessary cards, he may try his luck in the castle. In his turn, this player may choose one of the seven cards face down (three robbers, three neutral cards and the treasure). Either he won immediately (treasure map), he may try again in his next turn (neutral card), or he must begin again (robber card).

With beautifully illustrated game board.

171674.name: Scoundrel (Brawler Hybrid Class Archetype)
171674.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scoundrels are the masters of distracting and weakening their foes mid-combat. While there may be no honor among thieves, Scoundrels believe that honor is just a way for the weak to even the odds with the strong. They are also well known for picking up a strange weapon and using it as if having trained with it for years. While some may balk at a Scoundrel’s methods, no one can argue with the results, and having a Scoundrel on your side in a fight can mean the difference between walking away or being carried away in a bag.

171675.name: Mindbird Psionic Achaierai
171675.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Mindblast! Villains Augmented. This is the first in a series of psionic supplements de-signed to help you run games using the rules from Psionics Unleashed by Dreamscarred Press.

This product aims to give you a monsters with a psionic flair with a single, detailed nemesis for cheap. Everything you need to use these monsters is included here.

Presented here is the Mindbird, a psionic Achaierai to terrorize your players!

171676.name: Secret Societies of Vathak: The Final Phase
171676.description:
From publisher blurb:

“We are all wrapped up in the trials and tribulations of this existence. This tightly woven blanket envelops us to the point where we are insulated from the truth. We are asleep and may as well not be alive at all. The key to unlocking our true life is The Awakening.”

Secret Societies of Vathak: The Final Phase is a supplement for Shadows over Vathak, especially those exploring the area of the Colonies. This product is a perfect supplement for any Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, especially horror. The Secret Socieites of Vathak product line presents a secretative organization with description of their structure, leaders, initiation process, and more.

171677.name: Assassins of Porphyra
171677.description:
From publisher blurb:

Assassins are devoted killers, professionals or zealots with lifelong training in the art of murder. Unlike warriors, who face foes as they come, an assassin has a very specific goal in mind, and any violence except against the target is a distraction. The perfect assassination is never noticed—not even by the victim. Nor are they thieves—assassins might be skilled in infiltration, but their goal is never simple larceny. Still, no job is picture-perfect. Assassins are often pushed into the role of both warrior and rogue by their employer, cult, or guild. Nor is every murder on Porphyra a professional assassination.

Assassins of Porphyra further expands the world of Porphyra with:

Information on the main assassin orders on Porphyra
The new Porphyran Assassin class from Carl Cramér the mastermind behind the Prestige Archetype: The Assassin
Over 10 different Assassin Secrets to customize your character from the Arcane Assassin to the Shadow Assassin.
Favored Class Bonuses for the Core Book races.
Five new uses for skills
A sample 1st level professional assassin.

171678.name: Valkyria Chronicles - Challenges of the Edy Detachment
171678.description:
Experience an enthralling new chapter in the critically acclaimed tactical RPG, Valkyria Chronicles™, with an exciting expansion pack! Join the members of the Edy Detachment as they venture through 6 new maps of unique skirmish battles, each designed to feature a different soldier class; the scout, lancer, sniper, engineer, shocktrooper and the tank. Use of this expansion pack requires a copy of the original Valkyria Chronicles™ game as well as the latest patch.

Source: PSN Store Website.

171679.name: The Mystic: A New Dungeon World Playbook
171679.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nothing stays the same way forever. Everything changes with time. Do not get attached to what exists. Instead, strive to be free from all attachments. To do so is the only way to free oneself from pain and obtain a higher state of being.

The Mystic is a new playbook for Dungeon World for those who wish to play a martial artists.

Mystics do not use weapons, but, instead, form elaborate techniques of martial prowess by merging known tags together. Their years of physical training allow them to reduce the damage they take from strikes when unarmored and perform fantastic feats of acrobatics. Some may even dabble in the dark paths.

The training a mystic endures is not just focused on the physical. Mystics learn to see the universe in a new light and strive to uncover the mysteries of the world. They can learn to draw upon the inner energy known as Chi, free their mind from indecision and doubt, and master the gentle touch. Their wisdom may, one day, attract a student.

This playbook comes in two, nearly-identical packages: an "old school" and "new school" version. The difference between these packages are that they use different terms.

The "old school" version uses the terms alignment and race like the core DW classes.

The "new school" uses the terms drives and backgrounds (Styles, in this instance) as seen in many indie DW playbooks. Drives and backgrounds appeal to gamers who dislike the race/alignment restrictions in core DW playbooks.

171680.name: Underground Catacombs
171680.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a map of a large area of catacombs. It works great on its own as well as an extension for my map the Church and catacombs.

The map can be used both for online play as well as printed for an evening session. So what are you waiyting for, let your players do some dungeon crawling tonight.

Te map comes in two versions, one in colour and one in black and white.

171681.name: A Fistful of Horror: 02
171681.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the author of the '100' series of Adventure Seeds books, a new, shorter form source of inspiration for Games Masters. They might be adventures, non-player-characters, monsters, places... all ready to be dropped into your campaign, regardless of system.

In this booklet:

Head and Heart: There are more kinds of 'vampire' than the sparkly kind and some are truly bizarre and disgusting.
Small Town America: Ghost towns may be haunted, but it's not always by ghosts. Isolation can make people crazy and town pride can get out of control.
Burn Baby Burn: Its not always the vampires that are the predators or humans the prey. Challenging the status quo is dangerous for any man - alive or not.
Stitched Up: Taxidermy, especially the strange and creative side, is a dying art. Here's why.
Wandering Souls: What lengths would you go to for companionship if you were the only one of your kind in existence?

171682.name: 4089: Ghost Within
171682.description:
Sneak & battle your way through a procedurally generated mothership in this stealth action RPG! Supports user content & the Oculus Rift.

Source: The Game Website.

171683.name: Mad Games Tycoon
171683.description:
User Summary

It's time to build your own videogames empire. You start of as a beginning software firm in your own garage. But soon you will be getting bigger and getting more people on your team that will help you to sell the next hit game.

171684.name: The Way of Life
171684.description:
This explo­ration game has 3 main char­ac­ters: a busi­ness man, an old man and a child.

They find them­selves on a road which is appar­ently the same, but changes upon their per­cep­tion of real­ity. The core of the game­play is to explore in order to see how dif­fer­ent is each point of view. The player will switch from one char­ac­ter to another try­ing to cor­rectly and fully inter­act with all the envi­ron­ment. Miss­ing an inter­ac­tion or try­ing to inter­act with the wrong ele­ments will deter­mine “loss” in the game, caus­ing the game to restart from the beginning.

Source: The Publisher Website.

171686.description:
In the Wallenstein: Military Leaders expansion, each player receives one military leader figure to place on one of his controlled counties. While performing actions in this county, he receives extra benefits, such as reduced costs by 1 when constructing buildings or additional grain when producing it.

At the end of the turn, he moves the leader to an adjacent county under his control, if possible, while leaving a marker at the old location. The more markers you have on the board at the end of the game, the more points you're awarded.

Wallenstein: Military Leaders was presented as a Kickstarter exclusive while also possibly being available at conventions.
171686.name: Wallenstein: Military Leaders – Expansion Module 3

171687.name: Urgoth's Canyon
171687.description:
From publisher blurb:

Filbar Friday brings you FV2 – Urgoth’s Canyon. This area of adventure is a continuation from FV1 – Jeopardy Caverns and picks up where the party left off. If your party discovered the “back door” this is where it leads. It also offers an opening that flanks Jeopardy Caverns that has a perilous rope bridge to navigate! This area provides multiple smaller adventures and was utilized to get the party from different adventures. Portions of this adventure can be used as fillers in your own campaign. I hope you enjoy it as much as my players did!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for an initial to low level group of players. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

171688.name: Zwischen Freund und Feind
171688.description:
from the book

"Between Friend and foe": is an extensive role-playing campaign and a regional module at the same time.
