One red and one white. The top with the two discs is spun in the game box bottom which has a gridded board with various colored animals in it.

The red disc indicates what color of animal should be covered and the white disc indicates what animal. There are also provisions in the rules for covering multiple spaces. As an added twist it is acceptable to nudge the top to try and get it to throw a disc off in a particular direction!

171915.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Life is either a daring adventure or nothing. You're not sure which, but at least you've narrowed it down. You are rich with life experiences, but have had trouble trading them for goods and services.

It's time to seek your fortune, or anyone's really — whoever's is closest. To the west there's a land of milk and honey, full of giant bees and monstrous cows; to the east, a land of eggs and licorice; to the north, treacherous swamps; to the south, loyal jungles. But all of them have been thoroughly pillaged. You've heard legends, though, of a fifth direction as yet unspoiled, with its treasures conveniently gathered into troves. You have your sword and your trail mix, handed down from your father, and his father before him. You've recruited some recruits and hired some hirelings; you've shined your armor and distressed a damsel. You put up a sign saying "Gone Adventuring". Then you put up another sign, saying "Beware of Dog", in case people get any ideas. You're ready. You saddle up your trusty steed, and head florst.

Dominion: Adventures, the ninth addition to the game of Dominion, contains 400 cards, 60 tokens and six mats. This expansion has 30 new Kingdom cards, including the return of Duration cards that do things on future turns, plus Reserve cards that can be saved for the right moment. There are also 20 Event cards that give you something to buy besides cards, including tokens that modify cards.

Part of the Dominion series.
171915.name: Dominion: Adventures

171916.name: Made From Scratch
171916.description:
Made From Scratch is a culinary card game in which players compete to complete recipes. The cards that comprise a player's hand consist primarily of ingredients; such as poultry, butter, tomatoes, and spices. In playing those ingredient cards and providing more of the ingredients on a recipe than their opponents, a player gets to claim the recipe and bring it into their prep area. Limited kitchen space forces chefs to try and prep, cook, and score their recipes before they burn.

Made From Scratch captures the essence and complexity of preparing gourmet dishes and packages it in an easy to learn game that is guaranteed to leave you hungry for more.

171917.name: La Vie est une Jungle: Trahir est un plaisir
171917.description:
A trivia game where you can team up for a while with another player to answer the questions together and advance twice faster.
The twist is that the first one to break the alliance will continue alone, while the unfortunate partner will be send with the last player on the board...

171918.name: Point Perfect
171918.description:
Point Perfect puts your mouse hand to the ultimate test. In this fantasy world, the mouse cursor is your ship. Use your reflexes to avoid aliens, saucers, meteors, and all manner of retro arcade enemies. Draw boxes around your enemies to target for the mothership to shoot down. Do you have what it takes?

Features

- Dynamic gaming: Every time you fire up a game you get a new experience. Randomly generated levels, events and bosses.
- 20 Bosses to encounter and destroy. Collect trophies from boss kills to unlock a secret mode!
- 4 classes to choose from. At the start of each round, you will choose a class to for you play style. Going for a highscore? Then the Greed class might be for you. Maybe you're on a boss hunt. Then Utility or Power might be a better choice.
- Play a game in minutes! This is a casual game for hardcore gamers. Point Perfect is the ultimate time waster when waiting for ques for other games. Just fire it up, and improved your mouse control.

Source: The Game Website.

171919.name: Shannon Tweed's Attack Of The Groupies
171919.description:
All the groupies want a shot at a rock star, and Shannon Tweed has had enough! Cougars, slugs, beauty queens and bimbos - they all want a shot at the fame that comes with getting a rock star. These groupies are relentless and Shannon isn’t going to back down without a fight. Join her in her battle to stop crazed groupies from getting Her Man. It’s not going to be easy, but with a little help from some celebrity friends, you can help Shannon end the groupie invasion.

Main Game Features


Unlock celebrity characters
Power up and unlock new clothes
Unlock new and hilarious groupie characters to defeat
Featuring celebrity voiceovers by Shannon Tweed-Simmons, Tracy Tweed and Sophie Tweed-Simmons
Unlock exclusive celebrity content provided by Shannon Tweed


Source: The Developer Website.

171920.name: The Flying Dutchman
171920.description:
User Summary

The Flying Dutchman is a hidden object game where you will uncover the mystery of the legendary Ghost Ship The Flying Dutchman. Find the truth behind the legend by exploring hundreds of different objects randomly hidden in dozens of locations.

171921.name: Mirror Mysteries
171921.description:
About the game

A young family stops at an abandoned old house for a picnic and as the mother closes her eyes to enjoy the sun, she hears a door slam, the kids! As she enters this mysterious house an enchanted mirror whisks her off into 7 mysterious and enchanting lands that continuously lead her to rescuing her children and escaping The Mirror Mysteries.

Main Game Features


7 Enchanted worlds to explore
Unique hidden object gameplay
Can you rescue your children and escape this mysterious wonderland?


Source: The Developer Website.

171922.name: Mirror Mysteries: Forgotten Kingdoms
171922.description:
About the game

Did you love the smash hit The Mirror Mysteries? Try the next installation in the series and continue the saga! Tommy is all grown up and on the hunt for the mirror that changed his family’s life forever. But now he’s missing and his sister is counting on you to plunge into new worlds to find him. That evil mirror is back and it’s up to you to extinguish his power for good!

Main Game Features


Repair and explore enchanted worlds
Meet comedic characters
Unique broken item gameplay
Match wits with an evil mirror


Source: The Developer Website.

171923.name: Vault Cracker
171923.description:
About the game

Melissa lives an ideal life with her son Noah, but she's no ordinary mom. She was once one of the most sought-after cat burglars in the world. She's given up her life of crime and after living for years under a false identity, she took a trip to her hometown with her son. She thought it was safe. Things go wrong when Noah goes missing at the airport; Melissa's only clue is a phone call with a demand. It's been a long time but now she has one last job. With the help of her old friend Mouse, Melissa must find her son, his kidnapper and avoid the police radar. And she's going to have to crack a few safes along the way.

Main Game Features


New Hidden Object mechanics
Unique character customization feature
Immersive puzzles and Hidden Object levels
Crack safes and pick locks


Source: The Developer Website.

171924.name: Core Breach
171924.description:
CoreBreach is THE brand-new futuristic "anti-gravity"
racing game with combat-based gameplay.

Features include

•6 exciting anti-gravity racing ships from easily agile to ultra-fast
•6 beautiful, detailed and futuristic race tracks of varying difficulty
•6 different combat weapons incl. the deadly „Zeus Plasma Cannon“
•career mode with enthralling story-line
•upgrade ships and weapons with your trophy money
•unlock bonus tracks by accomplishing special objectives
•split-screen multiplayer support
•internet high-scores for global competition
•time-attack mode for endless challenge
•support for steering wheels and gamepads
•create new race tracks or play race tracks other users built

Source: The Developer Website.

171925.name: Nitro Racer XD
171925.description:
Nitro Racer XD kart competition is now open! There are more than 8 character were joined this competition and three banned character also joined this. You may ask how long is the competition. Well, it’s more than 60 races with track length at least 3 Km. Races in 7 different themes and defeat 6 tracklords so you can go to other portal. You can also upgrade your kart’s engine, tires, NOS limit. You’ll need to upgrade your kart, because the other player will never ever let you win.

With a Physics based kart that can run about 78 Kmh, can you win more than 60 races in this competition ?

Source: The Publisher Website.

User Addition

Originally the name of the game was Penguin Racer Go3D, but it was changed later.

171926.name: Bionic Heart 2
171926.description:
Compatible with Windows XP/Vista/7/8, Mac OS 10.6+ and Linux
- Dark and mature sci-fi setting with beautiful manga artwork
- Play as one of four different characters with their own unique goals
- High replayability: branching plot with lots of different endings to unlock
- Bonus content version available: full OST with 10 tracks, 16 wallpapers, and exclusive artwork not seen in the game!
The story picks up after the first game ends, where Tom, Luke, and Helen escape to Mars with fake IDs, and Tanya remains on Earth to fight Nanotech, the company led by Richard Meier.
The game is told from four different points of view:

- Luke, who is on Mars with his friends but he can't stop thinking about Tanya and what she told him
- Tom, who is also on Mars, has strong unconfessed feelings for Helen, Luke's girlfriend
- Tanya, an android that decided to stay on Earth, wants to fight against Richard, but will she be able to do it alone?
- Tina, an honest police officer, has strong suspicions about Nanotech and wants to investigate them.

Each character choice will change the outcome of the story.

Source: The Publisher Website.

171927.name: They Shoot Wild Horses
171927.description:
From the publishers webpage:

They Shoot Wild Horses is a Shadowrun, Third Edition scenario that hints at the dangerous times that evolve out of the events in Year of the Comet.

The year is 2061. Halley’s Comet has returned to remind the myopic people of the Awakened world that there are things outside of what megacorporation makes the biggest profit. The media has proclaimed 2061 the Year of the Comet and sees the comet as a blessing – something to take peoples’ minds off of the sewer that is their daily lives. Others see the heavenly messenger as the harbinger of bad times. The end of all bad times.

But the comet isn’t the only event occurring in 2061; the year marks the 50th anniversary of the Awakening of magic. Shamans and magicians have seen their ranks swell with charlatans, con men, and hucksters duping both the mundane and the magical alike with “remedies,” trinkets and protection “pills” to ward off the next “awakening.”

This only obscures those who are really preparing for what the next stage of awakening might bring…

171928.name: The Family Jewel
171928.description:
From the publishers webpage:

The Family Jewel is a short adventure for Shadowrun, Third Edition, intended for use as a one-shot introduction for new players. As it involves some of the intrigues of the great dragons as described in the upcoming Survival of the Fittest campaign, this adventure also makes a great starting point for a new game, and only minor changes will be necessary to use it in an ongoing game.

171929.name: Music in the Shadows
171929.description:
From the adventure introduction:

A team of runners are hired by Mr Johnson to investigate a relatively new band that has been doing very well. He wants to take over the band, but doesn’t want anyone to know he has.

Not much is known but this certainly isn’t just another up and coming starlet, someone has money and contacts behind her, this is going to be interesting…

From the authors webpage:

Written for and first run at GenconUK 2001 where 2 tables ran. Since run twice at Conception 2003. Returned to GenconUK 2004.

Both groups at GenconUK completed the adventure successfully, and managed to do it within the four hour limit, just. The two groups at Conception failed to complete the mission but seemed to enjoy themselves, which is what I consider a real success for a roleplaying scenario, did the GM and players enjoy it. The team that tackled this on its return to GenconUK also failed, this has proven a tough scenario to complete.

I suspect that run as a private game that this adventure could well take a lot more than four hours to play, maybe more like eight to twelve depending on how much time the players spend investigating it. The adventure is investigative in nature and there is more than one way to complete it so a group of players that investigate everything included will take a long time. This adventure will run very easily with a different group of characters to the group of Shadowrunners provided. Generally I found this a pleasure to write, and it's fun if demanding to run under tournament conditions as there is a lot to do. Expect to need several hours to read it, and rely on the aids provided within the adventure to find the information you want when running the game.

171930.name: Superstring Multiverse Worldbook 1
171930.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout the history of superhero comics, the concept of a multiverse has been used by numerous publishers to allow for characters to go on non-canon adventures, explore story options that would dramatically alter the primary narrative of the heroes and ask the question, “what if...?”

Superstring Multiverse is an attempt to recreate that freedom in your M&M tabletop game. Utilizing the characters from our Superhero Support line of products as a base starting point, we have decided to craft a vast and complicated multiverse of parallel worlds and infinite options to integrate into your game.

Superstring Multiverse Worldbook 1 expands upon the core concepts introduced in the Superstring Multiverse Core Supplement by introducing two new worlds on the Superstring.

First is World 10 - The Pantheon, a world in which the superheroes have been elevated to divine regard, acting as a super-powered world authority and keeping watch over humanity from their flying city of New Olympus.

Also covered is World 11 - Astro-Shifters, a world in which all superpowers are drawn from bizarre mystical energies that shift and change, altering a portion of the populace in unpredictable and chaotic ways.

These worlds are presented in the format introduced in the Superstring Multiverse Core Supplement and occupy spaces 10 and 11 in the Multiverse, for purposes of Hyperspace Travel. Each of these worlds can be used as destinations to be visited in a Multiverse-spanning campaign, or as the setting for an entire storyline.

171931.name: Trouble In The Gang
171931.description:
From the adventure introduction:

A group of rather assorted gang members from an up and coming gang are sent on a mission by their boss.

The gang is aiming to live above the gutters and has attracted folks a cut above the usual gutter scum. Now the potential is backing and something better assuming you can find out what the boss wants to know.

This being Seattle though troubles sure to be already on the way…

From the authors webpage:

Written for and first run at GenconUK 2002 where 3 tables ran. Since run once at Conception 2003. At least one other person whom I supplied a copy to has also run it after playing at GenconUK.

The groups at GenconUK did well, while the group at Conception had a fairly severe case of lead poisoning. However everyone seems to have enjoyed themselves and done quite well.

This adventure is intended for the characters provided as there is some background and linkage between the characters. However it could be adapted quite easily for any group of gang level player characters and lower end Shadowrunners could be tasked with the mission by reading the adventure and picking a suitable 'Johnson'. I cannot provide direct advice here though without excessive spoilers. This adventure will probably not run too much over the four hours outside tournament play, my best guess being six to eight depending on how fast you get on with it.

171932.name: #30 Magic Tools
171932.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rite Tool for the Rite Job!

Within #30 Magic Tools are little pieces of magic to make your job as an adventurer a bit easier.

These magical and masterwork tools will help keep you in the saddle, frighten foes, or keep people from noticing you as you walk through a crowd.

171933.name: Shadows at Sea
171933.description:
From the adventure introduction:

A group of Shadowrunners are hired for a somewhat delicate job. However its unusual, but then Shadowruns usually are, that’s why you want capable folks who think not guys with itchy trigger fingers.

Oh it should be entertaining, nice toys, wonderful locations, and well… telling you the catch would spoil the fun…

From the authors webpage:

Written for and first run at GenconUK 2004. Since run once at Conception 2005.

The groups at GenconUK did well.

A mission away from base this makes less use of contacts that some of the scenarios where contacts are critical. Players seem to work out that they need to be sensible and generally things have gone quite well. The ending can be a touch on the hazardous side but player characters have proven as resilient as ever to attempts to terminate them and have generally done ok.

171934.name: Adventure Module M1: An Echo of Days Past
171934.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Empire of Sarvania is spreading its wings and opening up a new land for exploration. A land about which little is known. A past civilisation, long lost to the mists of time holds the key to new prosperity for the brave and adventurous. But danger waits within this new domain.

Evil forces plague the countryside – a harbinger of a rising menace. Weapons are forged and forces are raised. An ancient power, born in the age of myth and legend stirs and calls on its supporters to open the gateway to the Material Plane – to reclaim a land once subjugated and lost.

A band of brave heroes heads unknowing eastward into this new territory – unaware of great peril ahead and of the great role they are to play in this unfolding story.

Adventure Module M1: A Echo of Days Past is a campaign designed to take characters from 1st Level to 5th Level in the world’s greatest RPG.

A Storm About to Break is the first instalment of a epic quest which will see the adventurers take on the might of Ehalazuhn, Lord of Destruction and his acolytes. The campaign will continue in Adventure Module M2: Beneath the Razor’s Edge.

171935.name: A Simple Twist
171935.description:
From the adventure introduction:

Mr Johnson wants a word, simple data snatch and a bit of investigative work, nothing new on the streets of Seattle.

However he’s hiring Shadowrunners and if one things for certain when a Shadowrun is involved not all will be quite as it seems. Question is not ‘is there something interesting going on…’ just what…

From the authors webpage:

Written for and first run at GenconUK 2005 where at least 5 tables ran. Since run once at Conception 2006.

The groups at GenconUK did well, while the group at Conception did very well indeed completing the mission alive in under 3 hours. So far all the groups I have run this for have done a good job of working things out and one team had a go at the big bonus available despite the risks.

Although extra sourcebooks are not required if you run this away from a convention setting having the sourcebooks mentioned is certainly beneficial so the players have the time to read up on one or two things if they don't know already. In a convention setting you won't have the time. No experience of Shadowrun is required but one or two players that have played a fair bit including some of FASA's campaign stuff from some years ago does help on the realising what certain things mean. If you have less experienced players make sure you explain just how important certain names are when they come up!

171936.name: Nontraditional Races
171936.description:
From publisher blurb:

Races- The Likes of Which You’ve Never Seen!

We have THIRTY TWO new races, unconnected to traditional fantasy and unlike anything you’ve played before. That means they are not a new subtype of elf, orcs with the numbers filed off, or another human with an elemental connection. These are new races, hot off the press, and ready to be dropped into your next game!

Each race comes not only with lore and racial traits (all of them are balanced as player races) but they each come with additional material. While it’s something of a mixed bag, we wanted to use these extra sections to say something about the race, they can include: racial weapons, racial feats, racial deities, racial animal companions, etc.

Highlights:

Living anthropomorphic weapons!
A playtest balanced huge-size player race!
A swarm race!
Animated puppets!
A race with an exposed brain!
Tarrasquelings!!!! (Yes, as in “descended from the Tarrasque”)

171937.name: Naga
171937.description:
From publisher blurb:

NAGA!

Once a petty criminal, the villain known as Naga was destined to be something greater. Armed with incredible martial prowess and a cult of followers, he bides his time, hoping to steal artifacts and eventually subjugate the world!

171939.name: Sorcerer Bloodlines 2
171939.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twelve new bloodlines for the sorcerer class! Unlock the spider-like abilities of the arachnid bloodline or the idolatrous menhir bloodline. For the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

171940.name: The Terramartian War Part 01: The Prologue
171940.description:
From Introduction:

This year’s FCF will be dedicated to the year-long campaign that will detail the crucial events of the war between Earth and the colonies of Mars. During this time, the characters will take on the roles of the important people that shaped the outcome of said war. Players may find themselves roleplaying singular characters throughout the campaign, or alternatively taking on various role in multiple sessions. These roles are determined by characters’ choice of Paradigms, as described in the Outbreak: Deep Space Core Rulebook. Thus a character can use the same stat block, but take on different Paradigms to reflect the different characters they play in the varying stages of the conflict.

171941.name: Oasis Ruins
171941.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 48 x 30 inch, full color battlemap of an Oasis Ruin.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT) and has a 360 degree view.

“You would deny an old woman her last request for one last drink? You think you own this water because you live next to it? It belongs to the earth not to you. I curse you with my last breath, may your thirst be everlasting!”

DramaScape brings a place for you to quench your thirst in the desert, but what happened to the nearby village?

Oasis Ruins is a single exterior map of a desert oasis and a ruined village that was built around the oasis.

Oasis Ruins is intended for use in primitive, fantasy, historical or modern games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Thirst!: By day, the village by the oasis is in ruins. At night, the village is lively with people walking around and intact buildings. However, any attempt to talk to these people reveals them as ghosts instead and touching the doors of the buildings reveals their ruined nature. The ghosts attempt to talk to the group, but there may be a language barrier, as they speak an ancient desert tongue. Frustrated by not being able to communicate, the ghosts may attack the group (they attack to stun rather than kill if possible). The ghosts try to tell the group not to drink the oasis water and how it came to be cursed if the group seems to understand their ancient desert language.

A wandering witch was dying in the desert and came to the village. Seeing her near death, the village refused to waste water on her. She died cursing the oasis village. Those who drink the waters of the oasis become thirstier with every drink of water. The people of the village all died bloated from water with their throats as dry as the surrounding desert. The ghosts are trying to warn them or at the very least chase them away from the oasis.

Another potential encounter in this scenario is the bloated corpses of the villagers as zombies, cursed to wander the desert seeking the water of the living.

boardgamecompilation.191998: Lost Legacy: Fourth Chronicle – The Werewolf & Undying Heart

171942.description:
User summary:

This is a Lost Legacy set that was handed out as a promo sheet (2 A4 sheets) on Game Market spring 2013. It runs on the same system as the other Lost Legacy sets, and contains no special rules.

Please refer to the family entry for details on the various Lost Legacy sets.
171942.name: Lost Legacy: The Immortal Heart

171943.name: Lost Legacy: The Mysterious Chest

boardgameversion.264128: Tokyo Game Market fall 2014 promo handout

171943.description:
User summary:

This Lost Legacy set was first handed out as a promo sheet (2 A4 sheets) on Game Market fall 2014 in Tokyo. The customers had to cut out and sleeve the cards themselves.

Please refer to the Family entry for details on the publications of the different sets.

171944.description:
Kite Fight includes three games in one box, with players using the kite, wind and lightning cards in different ways depending on what they're playing. The games included are:

• Catch the Wind — Imagine playing in a park with the land divided into quadrants by wind cards. Over the course of the game, players place kite cards in different parts of the park (that is, the space between wind cards) to try to have the highest valued kite cards on top of the stack, but the first card played in a quadrant determines which cards can be played to that area subsequently. Designer Jason Kotarski describes this game as "sort of a twist on trick-taking with players playing to multiple tricks at once over multiple rounds".

• Ride the Skies — Wind cards fill the air (or rather the table as they're laid out in a grid), and players place their kite cards on top of them to ride the wind. The trick, though is that the card being placed must be equal to the sum of the card being played on and one of the adjacent cards in the grid. Once all of the wind cards are covered, players check each pile to see who played the most cards on each pile, awarding the wind card to that player.

• Full of Air — Catch the most wind cards by participating in kite fights and outnumbering everyone else. To set up, a few wind cards are placed face up on the table, then players take turns placing a kite card at either end of the row, creating a sequence of 1-10 in each row. When a row is complete, whoever contributes the most claims the wind card from that row. Lightning cards let you zap another player's card and replace it with one of your own.
171944.name: Kite Fight

171945.name: Lost Legacy: The Qualities of an Adventurer

boardgameversion.264130: Tokyo Game Market spring 2015 promo handout

171945.description:
User summary:

This expansion, of unknown compatibility with all Lost Legacy sets, was first handed out as a promo sheet on Tokyo Game Market spring 2014. Unlike the other promo sheets, this is not a separate set, but a set of 8 special ability cards that are possible to use with any Lost Legacy set and that gives the player a special ability throughout the game.

The promo status of this expansion was primarily because it wasn't fully tested and the designer was not sure it wouldn't completely break certain sets or combinations of sets.

171946.name: Lost Legacy: Game Market spring 2014

boardgameversion.264131: Tokyo Game Makret spring 2014 promo handout

171946.description:
User summary:

A half unofficial Lost Legacy set, based on the Japanese indie board game scene, where every card represents an indie board game publisher.

Please refer to the family entry for details on the publication of various Lost Legacy sets.

171947.description:
In Big Easy Business, 2-4 players are aspiring business moguls in New Orleans buying up businesses and attracting tourists in order to prove their savvy and best the competition. They must compete to buy and utilize nightclubs, popular restaurants, tourist attractions, trinket shops, street bands, and more.

Players begin the game as one of several possible businesses, all with unique abilities. During a round, custom dice are rolled to create the action pool for all players. As players take their turns, they select a die for its action and execute it. Depending on what you choose, you'll be attracting tourists or cashing them out, buying new businesses (with new abilities), hiring new employees, etc. Combine that with blocking opponents out of actions, taking advantages of citywide events, and playing in a high-stakes poker game using the tableau you build...and you have Big Easy Business.
171947.name: Big Easy Business

171948.name: Lost Legacy: Game Market fall 2014

boardgameversion.264133: Tokyo Game Market fall 2014 promo handout edition

171948.description:
User summary:

A half unofficial Lost Legacy set, based on the Japanese indie board game scene, where every card represents an indie board game publisher.

The Lost Legacy in this set is "Lost Legacy Legend".

Please refer to the family entry for details on the publication of various Lost Legacy sets.

171949.name: Battle Skies
171949.description:
For thousands of years the Dragons have ruled the world of Erien, but their domain has become infested by other races - Elves, Dwarves, Fae, and worst of all, humankind. The dragons have done what they can to slow the process but the humans bred like rabbits and the other races weren’t much better. It didn’t take long for the inevitable conflict over resources to begin and the dragons soon realized that they didn’t stand a chance against the combined strength of the new races. Those dragons that survived are now forced to fight amongst themselves for food, a home, breeding grounds and anything else they want. They have taken to the skies to battle it out with others of their kind, knowing only the strongest amongst them will survive to become the lords of the skies.

Players take on the role of Dragons as they battle against one another in the skies over Erien. Their old sense of pride and self-importance mean that they must have the best feeding grounds available even if it means fighting other dragons to get it.

The game uses a system where at the start of each turn the players plot out their dragon’s movement for the turn. Movement is truly 3D allowing the dragons to fly up, down, left, right or any combination of directions. Elevation is tracked with stacking tiles and turns are shown with angled tilt blocks. Then with a bit of luck as their plans unfold on the game map their plans will have put them in to a better position to strike either with breath weapon or claw.

171950.name: Hands
171950.description:
Hands up! Hands down! No hands! Thumbs up! Point to the sky!

In Hands, you talk with your hands instead of words while trying to find a player whose hand speaks the same words as yours. Beware of the player talking with both hands, though — you'd better do as he says!

In more detail, during the game you mimic the cards in your hands while trying to find another player who mimics that same card. Each match you make this way scores you one point. But if any other player is making a two-hand symbol, you better not be the last player to imitate that symbol or else you'll lose a point at the end of the game.

Whoever scores the most points wins!

171951.name: Deck of Dice: Cypher System
171951.description:
From publisher blurb:

In your next cypher system game, instead of reaching for a d20, why not reach for a Dice Card!

This deck of 60 cards provides the same random possibilities that were traditionally accomplished by using dice.

Difficulty levels are pre-calculated, in addition to partial steps (displayed by the floating colored orbs around the number)
Each card also includes a six sided roll (mostly used for recovery rolls)




In addition to this simplification, the partial steps are coded into three colors, red, green and blue, of which you could create special house-rules that could result when the color drawn matches the partial step on the card. (you dont have to do this, but the option is there for you to implement such rules)

the quantity of the cards perfectly match d6 and d20 roll ratios

171952.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 1.8 - Dec 2014)

rpgissuearticle.135157: Misfit Studio's New Release -- Game Products

171952.description: The eigth issue of Misfit Studios' Newsletter.

171953.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 2.1 - Jan 2015)

rpgissuearticle.135160: Misfit Studios' New Releases -- Game Products

171953.description: The ninth issue of Misfit Studios' Newsletter.

171954.name: 47 Tips and Tricks to Become A Better Game Master or Storyteller
171954.description:
From publisher blurb:

When we sit down across the table from a group of players – whether they are lifelong friends or merely gaming buddies, we are taking on a role. Across the table from us sit a group of people who have appointed us as caretakers of their trust, their imaginations, and indeed a good many of their evenings for the coming weeks – perhaps months or even years.

By taking on this role, you take on the responsibility to tell a great and engaging story, to keep the momentum in a world, to make it all link together in a way that is believable, fun, and rewarding, earn the trust of your players, and finally, how to build and keep your integrity as a Storyteller.

The 47 Tips and Tricks listed below are intended to help you do just that. In the following sections, we will address five primary methods to become a great RPG Storyteller:

How to tell a story.
How to keep your game engaging.
How to tie it all together.
How to earn and keep the trust of your players.
How to establish and keep narrative integrity.




As always, our aim is to provide players and game masters alike with tools and ideas to help inspire their next game session. We hope you enjoy!

171956.name: OneDice Pulp
171956.description:
From publisher blurb:

OneDice Pulp is a game of all-out pulp adventure in a fictionalised version of our world. The action takes place in the 1930’s, as it was portrayed in the “pulp” magazines of that era. Whether you want to play a two-fisted sea captain, a scientist explorer or a mysterious masked avenger, all the rules you need are in this book.

There are additional “skins” for adding other pulp genres – Horror, Science Fiction and Swords & Sorcery. Now grab your fedora and whip, strap on your trusty revolver, and let’s get going!

boardgamecompilation.188826: Darkest Night Promo Pack: From Distant Lands

171957.description: The Enchanter is a special, promotional package that is being offered exclusively to BoardGameGeek. This package includes the Enchanter along with 10 power cards, plus a new event and an artifact. A must-have for all Darkest Night fans!
171957.name: Darkest Night: Enchanter Promo

171959.name: Captain Sou Orzen
171959.description:
From publisher blurb:

Captain Sou Orzen. This free-trader captain and his loyal crew ply the space lanes between systems hauling goods to make an honest living. But when honest jobs are scarce, they aren't above a little misbehaving! Part mercenary, part pirate and scavenger; Sou Orzen and his crew are not afraid to cross the line into extra-legal ventures chasing the almighty credit. With his battle-hardened crew and modified ship, Sou Orzen aims to carve out more than just a living from the universe.

This PDF release includes information on Sou Orzen, his ship the Merry Widow, and her crew, including background, personality, and how he treats his Allies, Contacts, Rivals or Enemies. There are also dozens of adventure hooks and ideas for using Captain Sour Orzen in your game.

171960.name: Vasko Anurin
171960.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Starport Authority (SPA) manages and builds all of the starports in imperial space. SPA inspectors like Vasko Anurin provide oversight of Starport operations, arriving unannounced with a team of investigatorschecking everything from airlock seals, accounts, traffic control protocols, and the honesty of starport personnel to the customs procedures,security procedures and so on.

Vasco Anurin is good at his job; he can smell a fake manifest in hard vacuum, ferret out a contraband cargo and spot the holes in Starport security. Though he is harboring a terrible secret, his loyalty cannot be purchased.

He is notabove using his influence to help friends or hinder foes, however.

171961.name: Marion "Sarge" Dynes
171961.description:
From publisher blurb:

t's a fact that 99.8 percent of all RPG adventures begin at a bar or tavern. Why should Traveller be any different? The latest release in the S.C.A.R.E. line details Marion "Sarge" Dynes, an ex ground assault marine turned bar owner!

This PDF release includes information on Marion Dynes, the "Charlie's Last Stand Bar" (named in honor of his father), as well as his background, personality, and how he treats his Allies, Contacts, Rivals or Enemies. There are also dozens of adventure hooks and ideas for using "Sarge" in your game.

171962.name: Hamnett Yamazaki
171962.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first volume of this series details Hamnett Yamazaki, Admiral and commander of all Imperial Naval Forces within the Sub-Sector . Hamnett is a study in contrast; he is a career Naval Officer that takes his duty seriously. He also employs means well outside the accepted code of conduct for Naval Officers. He views his job as overseeing the Sub-Sector as the main priority, and applies that motivation to all his actions. He'll take credits to look the other way while a container of fermented Anshevaax Milk passes through, or give a careless crew intercepted with illicit goods a pass so he can know more about a new syndicate setting up shop in "his" Sub-Sector. He will not let crimes like kidnapping, arms shipments or certain types of espionage go un-punished. While he considers himself an upstanding officer and would never do something directly harmful to the Imperium or his home system, like knowingly allow terrorists or prohibited weapons to pass unmolested; he sees other infractions of the Imperial code to be lesser sins. Indeed, sometimes "greasing the wheels" of commerce does more to avoid hostilities than a dozen peace negotiators. Hamnett learned long ago that it is impossible to prevent illicit goods from travelling the stars. "Profit finds a way" is one of his personal sayings. Hamnett is a realist, and he also realizes that if the goods are going to flow anyway, he might as well get a small piece of the profits. His current position as head of the sub-sector fleet facilitates this nicely.

This PDF release includes information on Hamnett including his background, personality and how he treats people he conciders Allies, Contacts, Rivals or Enemies. There are also dozens of adventure hooks and ideas for using Hamnett in each of these roles.

171964.description:
Description from the publisher:


Quiet for so long, the Night is rising again, spreading its tendrils of evil through the empty and unwatched backwaters of the world. Once again, Vampires are spreading from den to den, adding locals to the body count … or to their ranks. Can the Order regain its former strength and push back the tide of evil?


Vampire Hunters is a fully co-operative miniature-based board game for 1-4 players. It brings the dark imagery of Vampire lore from the classic stories in movies and books to your table top, as you take on the role of a newly recruited Vampire Hunter. Thrown into the Vampire den with a small band of comrades, you use stakes, crossbows and holy water to destroy the creatures of the Night. Craft makeshift weapons on the fly for more destructive power. Tear down window coverings to burn the Vampires with rays of Sunlight. Drag screaming Vampires outside the den with the Extractor. Team up and make combination attacks on your enemies. Always stay focused on your mission to power your special abilities.

But watch the clock: at sundown, you become the prey!

Optional game modes add to the replayability. Play standalone games or follow the full campaign, upgrading your weapons, equipment and special skills as you advance in the Order. Play semi-coop to rate your skills, giving bragging rights to the best Hunter. You can even play on as a Vampire, if your Hunter gets turned. Make Vampire Hunters the experience you want it to be!
171964.name: Vampire Hunters

171965.description:
Description from the publisher:

The many villains from the Multiverse have been bested by the Freedom Five or Dark Watch or the Prime Wardens or even heroes not from a particular team. Many of those villains are prideful and would not deign to work with others, as their goals would not align. However, some of them have seen the value of cooperating towards a common goal, and those villains have joined forces, even at cross purposes, to defeat the heroes who have harried them for so long.

Some of these villains, such as Plague Rat or Biomancer, are more hesitant to work with other villains, whereas others, such as Citizens Hammer & Anvil or Sergeant Steel, are more than happy to join forces with other like-minded combatants.

Villains of the Multiverse is a collection of ten super-powered villains for Sentinels of the Multiverse, and rather than being standalone villains, they work as part of a team of villains in the play style introduced in Sentinels of the Multiverse: Vengeance to group villains together as a team fighting against the hero team. Additionally, Villains of the Multiverse includes four new environments that can be used in any Sentinels of the Multiverse game.
171965.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villains of the Multiverse

171966.name: Pergame
171966.description: Inspired by Homer’s Iliad, PERGAME is a turn based strategy game that simulates the battle between Achaean and Trojan forces during the Trojan War. Keeping true to the spirit of time and the epic, the game focuses on the actions of heroes and constant involvement of the gods who are always ready to lend a hand to one side or the other. Common soldiers also have a role to play, and initially, their role comes down to guarding their champion. But beware, without a phalanx to support him, even Achilles may be felled by the hand of well-trained rank and file troops. During the battle, each player will try to defeat the opposing army in the field or to push it back to its base – Troy, or the Achaean camp. And then, when the going gets rough, and the battlements have to be breached, every single warrior is precious. Only good coordination of all elements – the power of heroes, the much needed support of the soldiers and timely interventions of the gods, can secure victory. Tyche be with you!

171967.name: Gargoyles Gigantik Game
171967.description:
Spin the spinner and move your playing piece clockwise around the board. Object of the game is to collect he most Gargoyle character playing cards as possible and to get rid of as many Xanatos and/or Demona cards collected during the game as you can before the game ends.

After all 32 cards in the deck have been played, players may disregard all spaces landed on except the Elisa Maza space. As soon as a player lands on any Castle Space the game ends. The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game. Points are scored by number of Gargoyle character cards you have. Each card is worth one point. If any players have Xanatos and/or Demona cards, subtract one point each from your score.

boardgameintegration.146408: Sentinel Tactics: The Flame of Freedom

171968.description:
Sentinel Tactics: Battle for Broken City is a standalone game using the Sentinel Tactics system that can be played on its own or combined with Sentinel Tactics: The Flame of Freedom with or without the Uprising expansion.

Sentinel Tactics: Battle for Broken City includes new playable characters, map tiles, and scenario books.
171968.name: Sentinel Tactics: Battle for Broken City

171969.description: Sentinel Tactics: For Profit contains additional characters and scenarios involving content from both the Flame of Freedom and Battle for Broken City core games for Sentinel Tactics.
171969.name: Sentinel Tactics: For Profit

171968.name: Sentinel Tactics: Battle for Broken City

171970.name: Monopoly: China Edition
171970.description: An edition of Monopoly specifically geared towards China. This version plays the same as the regular Monopoly, though the sets are named after well-known places throughout China.

171971.name: Bandersnatch
171971.description:
A Bandersnatch is a 3D figure with feet, a body, a tail and a nose. To win the players are trying to build Bandersnatch in rounds as in Cootie. But there are a couple of twists to the simpler game of Cootie.

To win a chance on getting a body part the player must win a spinner. The catch is that there is one less spinner than there are players. So in each round one player won't get a chance to obtain a Bandersnatch part.

The players all grab for a spinner when any player builds a hand of 4 cards of the same color. So there is an action/dexterity element to the game too.

Play begins with dealing 4 cards to each player. On a signal of go from the dealer all players look at their cards. If no one has four of a kind then each player passes card card face down to player on left. Again on go player pick up card and dtermine if they have four of a kind.

171973.name: RE: Alistair
171973.description:
RE: Alistair is a free English otome game. Merui is a girl who loves video games. She often plays an MMORPG called Rivenwell Online with her online friend Fiona. When a boy with the user name Alistair steals a rare item from her in the game and forces her into a bet to get it back, she is determined to exact revenge on him. Unfortunately, she has no idea who he is in real life. She finds out that only one of three boys from her school could be Alistair.

Source: Wikipedia, "RE: Alistair", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

171974.name: 4:20 The Boardgame
171974.description:
4:20 is a dice rolling game for 1 to 4 players. The aim of the game is to roll as many joints from your boss’s stash as possible.
But what fun is that unless you get to dabble in the goods?
By the time the clock hits 4:20am the player with the most J’s is declared King of Toke!
Just make sure you stay awake! Take too many puffs and risk ‘greening out’.
Move around the apartment, gather Joints, feed the munchies by raiding the refrigerator,
session up in the living room, or strip down and jump in the hot tub. The night is yours!

Setup:
Place the Board in the middle of the table. Place the time marker on the 4:20pm square of the time track.
Shuffle the Kitchen, living room, Hot Tub and Bedroom card decks and place each deck beside the corresponding room on the board.
Place the Joint tokens beside the board in reach of everyone.
Each player chooses a character and takes the corresponding player board and avatar.
The person who’s the biggest stoner starts. If you can’t decide who that is – play rock paper scissors to decide.
The Starting player places there character on any room in the house (except the bathroom). In clockwise order each player places their character in any empty room they choose (once again, not the bathroom). Only one player can be in any room at the same time.

How to Play
The starting player takes the 5 dice and rolls them all. They can then put aside any die they wish to keep (this is called “locking”). The player has 2 rerolls (unless stated otherwise like in “The Bedroom”) so can roll the dice 3 times in total per turn. After your rerolls you apply your results.
Each Turn Consists of
Resolve room power on board if it states “Start of Turn”
Roll all Dice. Put aside any dice you wish to keep (All clock dice are automatically “locked” – see below)
Reroll (this is optional) any dice up to 2 times except “locked” dice. They must be put aside.
Resolve dice (see below for results and order)
The Dice Results are as follows

J = Take one J token (1 per J)
M = Move. You must move to another location in the apartment. If it is occupied by another player they must move to your location as only one player per room is allowed. If 2 M’s are rolled you do not move and must take a card from the room deck you are in. If 3 M’s are rolled and you have no rerolls left you must move to the bathroom square. Your turn is over and disregard any other dice results except clock rolls. (do not collect J’s or dish out puffs)
C= Clock. Time passes and for every C rolled the time marker moves one square up. Every C rolled is instantly “locked”. You cannot reroll any C results (unless a card states otherwise).
P= Puff. All other players take a puff and must move their awake marker up one square on their player boards.




Order in a turn
When applying results, do so in the following order.
1 IF you have 3 “M’s” Proceed directly to bathroom , Ignore all other dice except clocks this turn. Advance clock if applicable and your turn ends.
2 Take all J’s
3 Everyone else takes Puffs
4 Move or take room card and resolve (if applicable)
5 Advance clock
6 End your turn. Pass dice to player on your left

Bathroom:
Nature called and you had to go to the bathroom. Damn, the locks broken.. How the hell do you get out you ask?! Getting stuck in the bathroom is no fun at all.
As soon as you enter the bathroom lose 5 J’s (they fell in!)
Roll dice as usual but.....Bathroom rolls are a bit different
No” J” results count when rolling dice, you can still make the others take puffs and the clock still ticks on as normal.

Escaping the Bathroom:
The only way out of the bathroom space (unless you have a card) is by rolling and “locking” 2 “M’s”. You must then go to any empty room in the house and play on as normal. If you have any rerolls left this turn you may continue to roll unlocked dice. Resolve dice normally at the end of your turn (ignoring the 2 “M’s” used to escape the bathroom).
Time / Awake Tracks / Game End
If any players awake track hits “white out” that player has fallen asleep and is out of the game. If all other players fall asleep the last player awake is the winner.
As soon as the time track hits 4:20am the game is over. All awake players add up their J’s and the stoner with the most wins! If that is also tied the most awake stoner wins....
If both J’s and Awake are tied..... geeeze?!? Play again!!

171975.description:
The avatar pawns were originally intended to be included in the game The Captain is Dead. These plastic components are not dissimilar from rounded meeples and are considered by some to be a better design for the game board as the stretch goal acquired visual pawns images are too busy.
This set was able to be purchased from The Gamer Crafter website following the The Captain is Dead Kickstarter.
The set included:
1 x yellow, orange, red, blue, purple, green and white pawns for players
12 x black pawns for aliens
The pawns can still be purchased individually.
171975.name: The Captain is Dead: Avatar Pawn Set

171976.name: Marvel Super Heroes 3D
171976.description:
The super villain, Grandmaster, is on the Earth and he has decided to have some fun at the expense of the five most powerful superheroes of the Marvel universe: Wolverine, Captain America, Thor, Spiderman, and Iron Man.

He has cooked up a despicable plan. He has imprisoned them into an intergalactic dome where he manipulates them like pawns! In order to get away, our heroes will have to face many challenges.
With 1 to 4 players, play this fun mix between a board game and an action game as one of these 5 super heroes.

During the board game phase, move through the Grandmaster’s secret base, and join forces to destroy the dome and get away.
During the action phases, play as your hero with a first-person view; swing from one skyscraper to another with Spiderman and spin your web to stop your enemies, protect yourself with Captain America’s shield, call down thunder using Thor’s hammer, pilot Iron Man’s suit in a canyon while destroying sentinels with your lasers, and let Wolverine’s knives do all the talking using your Wii Remote and Nunchuk.

Source: The Developer Website.

171978.description:
In The Dwarves: The Duel, one player takes the role of the little hero while the other uses both skill and the luck of the dice to lead the enemies of the country. Both players use card-decks with identical values but alternative artwork/naming.

The Dwarves: The Duel also includes new adventures for The Dwarves so that players can re-enact the events of the novel The Triumph of the Dwarves, which was released in German in 2015.
171978.name: The Dwarves: The Duel

171979.name: Flights of Honor: Pegasi of Everglow
171979.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is Pegasi home life like? What drives pegasi to seek out adventuring and what is their place in the pony empire?

These questions, along with new feats, a racial class archetype, spells and equipment all designed for our favorite feathered ponies!

171980.name: The Puppetmaster
171980.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fifty years ago, a great master craftsman suddenly disappeared. He no longer replied to pleas for his fine works of art. Nobility around the world mourned what they believed to be his passing.

Now, rumors are spreading of a small village beset upon by strange creatures. Some say they are the creations of the long forgotten craftsman. Is the Puppetmaster alive and the threat or is he merely a puppet himself to a greater evil?

171981.name: Fantastic Feats of Leadership
171981.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout history, and fantasy, leaders have come in all shapes and sizes. From Attila the Hun, whose battle prowess and skill with a horse made him lord of the Mongols to Tyrion Lannister, whose cunning and wit inspired others to follow his lead. Even a mythical figure like Odin used his wisdom over his personal magnetism to lead the Asgardian gods down the path he felt was best.

In Pathfinder, the bulk of this is covered simply in the Leadership feat. This feat attracts cohorts and followers under a banner, be it for a holy crusade against evil, the building of a Thief ’s Guild, or simply a powerfully charismatic adventurer simply inspiring others to follow his lead.

This PDF is a collection of feats meant to improve and augment the Leadership feat. This includes how it can modify adventuring, fighting monsters, or some of the other sub rules for Pathfinder.

171982.name: The Broken Bridge
171982.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was dark when they arrived at the bridge and they could all see that it was broken. Someone had laid some planks over the gap, a very crude job and passing over it seemed not to be a very good idea at this hour. On the other side of the river they could also see a small watch tower and in the top window a light was flickering as if a candle was burning.

This is a map that is perfect to use for breaking up the adventurers travel between two sites. It depicts a river crossing with a broken bridge, a tower and a ruined house among some hills and trees.

Will the adventurers be ambushed here when they try to cross, who lives in the watch tower, why is the bridge broken, the possibilities are many.

The map is meant to be shown to the players during play and it works just as well for online and offline sessions.

The pdf is in letter format and consists of three different versions of the map, two coloured and one black and white. One of the coloured maps and the black and white version has a grid attached to it.

171983.name: Ex-Arcana
171983.description:
From publisher blurb:

Over a century ago, there was a secret war, and an end to all magic. Now the Century of Silence has passed, and the Thresholds are re-opening, spilling victorian magic, monsters, and mayhem back into a world that thought it had passed them by. Maybe you’re a recently-enlightened mystic, maybe you’ve spent the last hundred years sleeping and waiting for a chance to return. It’s a new dawn for the ancient arts; can you master the Æthers before they master you?

The ExArcana cards provide a wide variety of aether-slinging spells, supernatural races, and eldritch items. These are the tools and the talent you can use to tackle the penny dreadful creatures, oathbreaking magicians, and various other full roaming vapors that mean harm to the world.

171984.name: Ex-Arcana Skein Deck
171984.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new world setting for CHRONOS Universal LARP system.

The flagship Skein for the Chronos Universal system comes with brand new character types, occult-based Specialties, and magical spells from Augury to Voodoo. Step into the world of ExArcana and take your place among the secret societies of the Arcanum as a powerful Victorian Magister or a streetwise modern-era Guttersnipe. This deck contains magical Spells, mystical Auras, clandestine Leagues, inhuman Aberrations, intricate Cryptic Arts, dozens of powerful magical Talismans and more!

In ExArcana, you play a Magician who lives within the supernatural world that exists along side the world you already know. You can choose to be a newly reawakened archaic Magister, or a modern-era Guttersnipe. With threats seeping into the world from outside the earthly realm, internal politics threatening the Leagues, magical threats re-awakening, and the Oathbreakers looking to enslave the world, you have a duty to uphold the four Oaths and to defend the Silent Masses from the threats both within and without.

Deck Contains:

Each card has the game mechanics on the card, so no more looking up powers in a book mid-game
Each card has color and design coding to make selection simple
8 Aura Cards
16 Craft Specialty Cards
8 Aberration Cards
22 Spell Cards
22 Talisman Cards
4 Cryptic Art Cards

171985.name: Odyssey
171985.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Greek Source Book for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game

So you guys asked for it so we made it! We did a small, cheap, quick play Greek campaign setting for Greek games in Pathfinder. Get your epic on!

Included:

Greek Gods: The 12 Olympians, their alignments, domains, favored weapons, etc.
How To Play a Greek Game (The Sea, Flaws, Acceptable Racee, Bronze Age Weapons, The Gods, Magic, and "Only Artifacts")
Greek Equipment
New Races (Amazon, Satyr, Minotaur, Centaur, and the 1/2 God Template)

171986.description:
In Reino de Ambar (Kingdom of Amber), players assume the roles of heads of influential families, politically and militarily, in the kingdom. In the shadows, players compete for prosperity and reputation. As head of the family, each player tries, through the skillful use of his seven cards Action, increase the power, influence and prestige of his family, avoiding in turn be destroyed by barbarian hordes who claim ravage the kingdom.

When you play an action card, you can add influence in places where influential people in the kingdom. So, for example, when you choose to increase its influence on the Market, Gold increases its access; or when providing care to the Castle, receives more influence; or when visiting the wicked witch who lives in the Cave removes a marker of influence of one of his opponents.

Each player along just seven rounds, following his own path, make its own choices with action cards from his hand to try to gain prestige.

In each round the players have also should try to solve two of the most serious problems plaguing the Kingdom. Whenever a problem is resolved their savior can enhance their prestige or position, use the special Confident or hire the services of places or personalities. In contrast, if the problems that appear in each round to win the barbarians are resolved. Rarely, the best choice is obvious, but often not be. A good player will find the right moments to make the best use of their cards and solve problems.

At the end of the game, the player with the most accumulated prestige is the winner.
171986.name: Reino de Ambar

171989.name: Three Inch Glory II
171989.description:
Three Inch Glory is a wargame set in the 18th Century and designed for play with Playmobil® figures.

Requirements:

two armies of 10 to 100 figures each
a ruler for measuring formation maneuvers
a 20-sided die or a computer for the spreadsheet calculator




End conditions differ by scenario, but the basic game is to play until an army surrenders or is eliminated.

171990.name: Three Inch Glory III
171990.description:
Three Inch Glory is a wargame set in the 18th Century and designed for play with Playmobil® figures.

Requirements:

two armies of 25 to 250 figures each
a deck of cards for officer/orders activation
a ruler for measuring formation maneuvers
lots of 6 sided dice for resolving attacks




End conditions differ by scenario, but the basic game is to play until an army surrenders or is eliminated.

The third iteration of the game has been simplified from the previous edition. Notably, the rulebook is half the previous length.

171991.name: Observation Bunker
171991.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 235th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small bunker at a narrow ramp bridging a low cliff.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4320x4032 pixels in size at 144dpi.

171992.name: Big Game Hunt
171992.description:
From the designer:
A game of dinosaur hunting for ages 7 and up! These straightforward, fun rules take up an entire 2 pages, including character record sheets! Plenty of fun with miniature figures, toy dinosaurs and anything else you have lying about.

User note:
The game calls for a deck of cards for activation (though the specific rules are ambiguous). Uses 1-2 d6 with modifiers for most actions. Solo play is possible, because dinosaurs move relative to the nearest hunter.

171993.name: Bugs!
171993.description: Bugs! is a simple miniatures combat game played with plastic insects, tokens for goals (like candy), a few polyhedral dice, and a ruler. A player must get at least one bug on each goal to win.

171994.name: Come With Me If You Want To Live!
171994.description:
Come With Me If You Want To Live! is a roll-and-move game with "take-that" cards.

Players take the role of leaders who seek to save a chosen few. Each is convinced that only they can save their followers from a coming apocalypse. Your goal is to have the most followers at the end of the game.

171996.name: Another Bunch of Content (Issue 2 - Dec 2014)
171996.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second issue of the monthly system neutral series Another Bunch of Content has been released! Each month, InfiniBadger Press brings you 26 new pieces of open content for you to use in your games, one for each letter of the alphabet. Monsters, items, locations, people, encounters, dungeons, and a slew of anything else that that we think that you might be interested in will all be put together into these jam-packed system-neutral newsletters for your gaming utility and pleasure.

171997.name: 1936: España Dividida
171997.description:
1936 - Spain divided, is based on the classic system of "A House Divided", modified to play modern warfare wargame.
After the failed coup, led by the army, against a weak republic, the Spanish territory and society, it is split almost exactly in half, into two opposing camps.
This is a game for two players, Nationalist and Republican.
The Nationalist army with better troops form North Africa, best foreign support of Hitler and Mussolini, get advance control of the country.
The Republican, despite having major cities, will have to organize a new army, on the basis of militia enlisted from the start of the war.
The objective of the game is that the Nationalis player controls whole country before the end of the war. Otherwise the Republican wins the game.
It is also possible that the Republican player wins before the end of the game.
The game features a map of 25,5x22 , one 5/8?? counter sheet.
The army of players is divided into grades. These are, columns, regular, veterans and elite. The two armies will evolve during the game to better qualities or worse depending on conditions of each side.
The full game lasts 29 turns, each player starts with 14 combat units.
There aviation support units, artillery and armored.
Also special units such as moros, requetés, Italian, international militia etc ...

171998.name: Världsmästare eller stolpskott?
171998.description:
Do you follow all sports on TV or are just turned into a sportsnerd at the olympics? Are you an athlete or a couch potato? This is the quiz game that reveals if you are a champion or belong at the substitutes' bench. Contains 265 fun and tricky questions about sports divided into these categories:

"Snow & Ice", "The ball is round", "Olympic", "The Pro question" and "Misc".

The game gives some ideas on how to play the game but there are no strict rules.

171999.name: Monster Deck 1
171999.description:
User description:

A 52-card poker-sized deck of monster illustrations. No stats; just names and pictures. Available in PDF from the publisher. Print version was distributed as part of the 2012 Kickstarter.

172000.name: Encounter Deck Level 1
172000.description:
user summary

A 52-card poker-sized deck of encounters suitable for the first level of a dungeon. Available in PDF from the publisher; was printed for the 2012 Kickstarter campaign.
